description:
Description du poste
Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Talend passionné pour rejoindre notre équipe.

Dans le cadre de projets ambitieux de transformation numérique, vous serez en charge de concevoir, développer et déployer des solutions d'intégration de données performantes.

Vous travaillerez au sein d’une équipe dynamique, collaborant avec des experts pour garantir la réussite de nos projets.

Vos missions :

Acheminement de la donnée : 
Recueillir les besoins métiers des différentes. 
Développer les solutions techniques de collecte de la donnée 
Développer des solutions techniques de stockage de la donnée 
Réaliser les tests unitaires et d’intégration. 
Mise à disposition des données : 
Industrialiser et automatiser le nettoyage de la donnée selon les spécifications retenues. 
Gérer, maintenir et documenter les flux de données 
Assurer le suivi de production et la maintenance. 
Suivi des projets de développement : 
Établir les spécifications techniques à partir de l’analyse des besoins. 
Reporter l’activité auprès du chef de projet. 

Qualifications
Profil recherché :

Ingénieur de formation supérieure.
Vous avez au moins 3 ans d’expérience sur des problématiques de data engineering et des compétences sur Talend Data Intégration ou Talend Big Data dans un contexte agile.
Vous disposez des connaissances sur les architectures de données et les environnements cloud 
Vous disposez d’une expérience en visualisation de données (PowerBI, Tableau, QlikView, D3.js…)
Vous maîtrisez au moins un langage de programmation spécifique (Spark, Scala, Python, Java, SQL)
Vous maîtrisez des systèmes d’exploitation (UNIX, Linux, Solaris ) avec une expertise dans le stockage de données et les outils ETL.
Toujours en veille, à l’affut des nouveautés technologiques et vous aimez échanger (Events, conférences, meetups, etc…).
Force de proposition, vous vous sentez libre d’oser et de vous surpassez en partageant vos idées.
Vous maîtrisez l’anglais à l’oral comme à l’écrit.

Profil   Profil recherché :

Bac+5 en informatique, génie logiciel ou domaine connexe.
2 ans d’expérience en développement ETL (Talend, Informatica, Apache NiFi, etc.) et API.
Expérience en conception et développement d’API (REST, GraphQL).
Maîtrise de SQL, des bases de données relationnelles et des langages comme Python, Java ou Scala.
Expérience avec les environnements cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) appréciée.
Forte capacité analytique et esprit collaboratif.


Informations contractuelles

Our client, a fast-growing consulting organization that specializes in affiliate marketing/PR support for DTC businesses, is looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Marketing Operations Associate to join their team. Our client works closely with various DTC brands to streamline their affiliate marketing processes, optimize operations, and drive results. This role is ideal for someone who is equally focused on quality and efficiency, a critical thinker who not only executes but also takes ownership in improving processes. You’ll support the team with operational tasks, affiliate program management, and optimizing workflows through AI tools.

Location:
Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Key Responsibilities

Affiliate Program Support: Assist in managing affiliate networks, relationships, and partnerships from the backend, ensuring smooth operation of affiliate programs for DTC brands.

Operational Support: Provide operational and administrative support, including but not limited to organizing data, maintaining spreadsheets, and preparing reports.

Task Optimization: Utilize AI tools to optimize workflows, automate processes, and enhance operational efficiency.

Creative Problem-Solving: Proactively identify and implement solutions to improve affiliate marketing processes and operational effectiveness.

Data Management: Support data entry, tracking, and management in spreadsheets, ensuring accuracy and timely updates.

Process Improvement: Suggest and drive improvements in affiliate program operations, contributing to the overall success of the business.

Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams, including marketing and sales, to support the execution of affiliate campaigns and meet client needs.

Learning & Adaptability: Be open to learning new tools, systems, and processes to enhance skills and drive better results for the business.

Qualifications

2+ years of experience in operations or marketing support, preferably in a DTC or affiliate environment.

Experience with affiliate networks and managing DTC brand partnerships is highly advantageous.

Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills; ability to proactively manage tasks and processes.

Experience using AI tools to optimize tasks and workflows is a plus.

Excellent organizational skills with a strong attention to detail.

Comfortable working with spreadsheets and Excel for data tracking, reporting, and analysis.

Solution-driven mindset with a focus on achieving operational excellence.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Operational mindset, adaptable to various tasks and willing to learn new processes.

What Success Looks Like

Operational Efficiency: Streamlining affiliate program operations and achieving measurable improvements in efficiency and accuracy.

Affiliate Program Growth: Successful management and growth of affiliate programs, ensuring smooth operation and high-quality partnerships.

Task Optimization: Demonstrated ability to optimize workflows and processes through AI tools, resulting in time savings and improved productivity.

Creative Problem Solving: Effectively identifying and resolving issues, ensuring that tasks are completed efficiently and accurately.

Data Accuracy: Ensuring that all data is accurately tracked and reported, supporting business decisions and client success.

Opportunity
This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing company and play a key role in optimizing affiliate marketing and operations for DTC brands. If you are a motivated, detail-oriented individual with a passion for operational excellence and affiliate marketing, we would love to have you on the team.

Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form

Record a video showcasing your skill sets

ABOUT UNILEVER


With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.
At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.
CATEGORY INTRODUCTION


This position combines the best of strategic influence and operational impact. you’ll lead the execution of Nutrition category in collaboration with our CBD teams, utilizing data insights and customer-centric tools to meet critical KPIs (growth, profitability, market share) at the customer and channel level. If you thrive in a high-energy, performance-driven environment, enjoy fostering cross-functional partnerships, and are motivated by delivering results, this role is your platform to make a measurable impact.
JOB PURPOSE


The CSP assistant manager will drive Morocco Nutrition customer agenda, ensuring category and channel plans are implemented effectively and adapted to meet customer needs. This involves accountability to ensure platform / category verticals objectives are delivered via channel & customer growth strategies & supported by holistic trade investment. You will ensure our category growth strategy is reflected in all customer and market plans, directly impacting the shopper experience – working closely with platform marketing & CSP & delivering via CBD teams.
WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE


S&OP
Responsible for forecasting by category/channel across categories Onboard the CBD inputs into the S&OP. Owns the trade activity grid by Category/ channel/customer
Category Growth Strategies


Localise (Develop and deploy) CGS at channel and customer level, Work closely with Brand, CMI, NRM, Shopper Marketing to build Customer sell-in
Innovation


Define national innovation & launch plan to channels/customers. D4C/D4R: executes locally AND integrates upstream into BU
Targets and Budgets


Allocate USG targets and investment to deliver strategy by channel and customer Define budgets by channel and customer to deliver UOM target from BU. Manage the TTS spending E2E
Pricing and promotions, Mix


Own Pricing & Promo strategy in collaboration with marketing. Lead monthly forecasting process and report and own Pricing & Promotions Mix NRM:  Ownership of L4 and L5 along with CBD
Execution


Deploy strategically aligned commercial plan in Market via CBD Deploy launch plans to channels/customers to ensure strength of execution Define channel / Customer Execution: (SoS, TDP). Shopper / Digital marketing led Assist the CBD team in formalizing the annual JBPs for key customers in the country.
Capability


Deploy core capabilities required to win by Channel and Customer. Catman / Shopper / NRM
WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED


Experiences & Qualifications


3 years relevant Category & Customer experience 1-2 years Account management experience is an advantage Customer Facing experience combined with Brand Building experience is ideal Shopper Marketing or Brand Building experience is desirable
competences:
Skills


Innovation mindset Commerce channels execution and digital business models Commercial Strategy and Business Acumen /NRM Category Growth Management Data-Drive Mindset Entrepreneurial Leadership Digital Commerce Customer and Retailer Understanding Customer Relationship Stakeholder Management Process Thinking (Discipline) Strategic Thinking
Leadership


You are an inclusive motivator of people. Your team deliver with real passion, growing and learning from each other whilst delivering quick wins. You are still responsible for your own results and as a manager, you also need to motivate others to deliver with passion, creating an inclusive and engaging climate around you. You can balance challenge with support and coaching. You understand the wider business context and you are emotionally intelligent enough to motivate people to deliver what is needed.
Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors

+ PERSONAL MASTERY: Sets high standards for themselves. Has emotional intelligence to take feedback, manage mood and motivations, and build empathy for others. + PASSION FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE: Generates intensity and focus to motivate people to deliver results at speed. Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results.
+ TALENT CATALYST: Invests in people – coaches individuals and teams to realize their full potential. Creates an inclusive climate, empowering everyone to be at their best.
+ PURPOSE & SERVICE: Has humility, understanding that leadership is service to others, inside and outside Unilever.
+ CONSUMER LOVE: Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers.
+ BUSINESS ACUMEN: Creates sustainable growth with purpose, engaging different partners across the system for change.

intro:
Job Title:

Consultant, BI
description:
Job Description

As a consultant, you will play a key role in delivering enterprise-level reporting, dashboard solutions, and actionable insights across corporate domains. You will lead BI projects , Mentor Others, collaborate with stakeholders, and serve as a subject matter expert in translating complex business needs into scalable Domo solutions.
This role is 100% remote from any country/region

Key Responsabilities : 
Lead the design and delivery of BI dashboards, KPI models, and end-to-end reporting solutions using Domo and other BI platforms.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications with strong data modeling and storytelling capabilities.
Serve as the primary POC for Corporate stakeholders, providing advisory support and guiding on data strategy.
Mentor junior BI team members and ensure adherence to development standards and governance protocols.
Collaborate with data engineers and domain experts to ensure data quality, integrity, and alignment with business definitions.
Manage intake of new requests, prioritize based on business impact, and communicate delivery timelines clearly.
Drive UAT processes and support stakeholders in interpreting insights and identifying business opportunities.
Required qualifications: 
Expert in Domo with end-to-end dashboard development experience.
3+ years of experience in BI, data analytics, or corporate reporting roles.
Strong grasp of data modeling, ETL workflows, and KPI frameworks.
Excellent communication skills, especially in explaining complex data to non-technical audiences.
Location:

MAR Rabat - 43, Boulevard Ibn Sina, Agdal
Language Requirements:

Time Type:

Full time

titre: Associate Scientist II or Scientist I, Rheumatology
intro:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.
description:
Job Description

We are looking for a highly motivated scientist to join our Rheumatology team at our Cambridge, MA office. The ideal candidate should be driven, experienced, collaborative, adaptable, and productive. They will support in vitro research efforts for our existing early-stage through late-stage discovery portfolio programs. Responsibilities include conducting, analyzing, and reporting on in vitro assays to explore key biological questions related to rheumatic diseases, such as RA, Systemic Sclerosis and Psoriatic Arthritis. The candidate should apply fundamental scientific principles to research and be skilled in laboratory techniques such as pipetting, cell culture, molecular biology and ELISA. In addition, a candidate with experience in fibroblast cultures and functional assays (proliferation, migration and invasion) and model development is preferred.

Responsibilities

Scientific Research: Design and execute precise in vitro experiments to advance understanding of rheumatic disease biology.
Lab Techniques: Skillfully use methods like pipetting, cell culture, molecular biology, ELISA, fibroblasts functional assays (proliferation, migration, invasion), fibroblasts-based model development and flow cytometry to collect quality data.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret results accurately, creating reports and presentations to share with teams.
Protocol Development: Follow and adapt experimental protocols while implementing new methods as needed.
Lab Management: Maintain equipment and manage supplies to ensure efficient lab operations.
Literature Review: Review literature for insights that aid experimental design and contribute ideas.
Collaboration: Work with cross-disciplinary teams, offering scientific expertise to drive project progress.
Documentation: Accurately maintain and update lab notebook and lab inventories of cell stocks, reagents etc.

Qualifications

Education/ Years of Experience: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Biology or a closely related discipline with typically 0-2 (MS) or 3-5+ (BS) years’ experience.
Professional Experience: Demonstrated proficiency in cell culture techniques with a strong grasp of molecular biology, including practical expertise in fibroblasts culture. 
Fibroblasts related functional assays (proliferation, migration and invasion assays with incucyte), flow cytometry and ELISA are strongly preferred.
Experience with data analysis and use of PowerPoint, Excel and GraphPad Prism and maintenance of data records on electronic lab notebooks.
Communication Abilities: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the capability to explain complex scientific ideas clearly and encourage collaborative dialogue.
Interpersonal Capabilities: Proven ability to thrive in a team-oriented setting, displaying strong interpersonal and teamwork skills.
Organizational Skills: Outstanding time management and organizational abilities, adept at handling multiple priorities and tasks effectively.
Learning Aptitude: A proactive and adaptable learner with the ability to independently generate and assess data, while quickly acquiring and applying new skills.
Position will be hired based on level of experience - Associate Scientist II or Scientist I 


Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: 


The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. 


Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.

titre: ALM Consultant (Asset Liability Management) - Netherlands Wealth Business
intro:
# ALM Consultant (Asset Liability Management) - Netherlands Wealth Business
Location
Rua António Pedro, no. 111, 1150-045 Lisbon, Portugal
Category
Consulting
Job Id
R\_298931
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
We are seeking a talented individual to join our Wealth Business team at Mercer. This role will be based in Lisbon. This is a hybrid role that has a requirement of working at least three days a week in the office.
You will be supporting the Dutch team (based in Amstelveen or Rotterdam) and provide all possible support from start to finish in the process to ultimately deliver advice to the client in the most efficient and effective manner and at the highest possible quality.
In addition to your focus area, you will have the opportunity to develop more broadly and will be involved in various projects across different departments within Mercer. You will have the opportunity to work with clients that come from the top of the market, including corporate pension funds, industry pension funds, large corporations, multinationals, and SMEs. Their success partly depends on your communication skills and your courage to propose innovative ideas.
We will count on you to:


Carefully process and analyze financial data, documentation, and problem statements, contributing to providing the right strategy or solution for the client. Translate complex actuarial problems into detailed calculations/projections using Excel and programming languages such as Python. Prepare reports, presentations, and advisory memos, and assist colleagues with pension and employee benefits-related research. Keep up with relevant developments and current events in your work area and apply them in your work. Plan your own tasks and proactively contribute to team objectives.
What you need to have:


Degree in Econometrics, Actuarial science, Mathematics. Minimum of 1-3 years of relevant work experience. Passion for programming. Proven knowledge and ease with VBA/Python. Strong analytical skills. Excellent interpersonal skills - Focused on providing the best client experience. Ability to build strong working relationships with colleagues and clients. Strong problem-solving skills & ability to clearly articulate complex issues. Excellent planning and organisational skills in order to prioritise and effectively manage a wide variety of ongoing tasks. Proficient in English, both spoken and written (C1/C2). Basic knowledge of Dutch is a plus.
Proactive and goal oriented. Attention to detail is critical. Strong Microsoft Office skills. Interest in Investments and pensions market; modern technology and/or big data.
Why join our team:


We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders. We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues, clients and communities. Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well-being.

Mercer, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a global leader in helping clients realize their investment objectives, shape the future of work and enhance health and retirement outcomes for their people. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit mercer.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.

Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

intro:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.
description:
Job Description

Discovery Biotherapeutics and Genetic Medicine (BGM) at AbbVie is seeking a highly motivated research scientist to join the Cell and Functional Biology group at the Cambridge Research Center (CRC). The CRC site based in Cambridge, MA offers a unique setting where BGM, Immunology, Neuroscience, and Genomic Research Center co-exist.  In this role, you will be responsible for the conceptualization and execution of cell- and protein- based functional characterization assays for lead antibody identification/optimization and collaborating to generate stage-gate appropriate in vitro / cellular / in vivo data packages supporting PoC for Neuroscience programs. The ideal candidate should have strong experience with cell-based assays, cell culture and antibody screening and significant experience in flow cytometry, fluorescence-based assays and imaging. Familiarity with high-throughput screening and multi-specifics is highly valued. The applicant should be able to analyze, document, and report data. You should possess excellent communication skills and be comfortable working in cross-functional teams.

Job Responsibilities:

Lead the development and implementation of cell-based fluorescent assays to enable function-first antibody screening across multiple therapeutic areas and drug discovery stages.
Design, optimize, and validate assay protocols, ensuring robustness and reproducibility across projects.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets, providing insights and recommendations for next steps in research projects.
Stay abreast of technological advancements in cell-based assays, fluorescence applications, and imaging techniques to support the expansion of function-first assay design.
Develop close cross-functional relationships with therapeutic area scientists to drive synthesis of innovative ideas and solutions to achieve organizational goals.
Demonstrate scientific excellence through dedication to multiple projects in a fast-paced multi-disciplinary environment

Qualifications

BS, MS, or PhD and typically 12+ (BS) years, 10+ (MS) years, or 4+ (PhD) years of experience in Biology, Molecular and Cellular Biology, Biomedical Engineering, Neuroscience or other related field.
Proficient in conceptualization and implementation of in vitro cell-based assays.
Experience with fluorescent based assay development with expertise in cell-culture, flow cytometry, ELISA/microplate cytometry and imaging platforms.
Proficiency in data analysis and statistical software.
Ability to work independently as well as part of a collaborative team environment.
Strong attention to quality and details when exercising organizational, documentation and communication skills.
Desirable:

Experience with high-throughput screening, programming and multi-specific antibodies.
Experience with external collaborations and partnerships.

Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: 

The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. 

This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs


Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law. 

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. 

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
We are seeking a talented individual to join our Mercer Marsh Benefits (MMB) team. This role will be based in Casablanca Morocco, hybrid and has a requirement of working at least three days a week in the office.
Important Notice: Recruitment process will be conducted in English. Please submit your application in English.
As a Health & Benefits Consultant you will work with a wide range of companies to help them assess, develop and deploy strategies, programs and initiatives to improve the health and wellness of their employees in Africa. Advise clients on best practices, financial management, compliance, communication and administration of health and benefit plans.
We will count on you to:


Provide financial, contract and/or administrative analysis, and manages portions of projects, including ad-hoc client requests of problem-solving on administrative and operations issues Support financial analysis and review: including underwriting, data analytics, and partnership with actuaries to support funding analysis Contribute as a member of the consulting team in developing overall client strategy, interprets and presents benchmark data to client and ensures plan and program changes are properly implemented embody client’s strategy Manage internal specialty resources ensuring client deliverables meet client’s goals and deadlines and delegates and reviews project work of more junior colleagues Assist with the preparation, completion of peer review process and delivery of clear and concise client-friendly communications Work directly with the client and manages the request for proposal (RFP) process with the health insurance carriers and internal analyst Collect and review the analyst’s compilation of health benefits information from a variety of sources (such as hard files, electronic files, the client and carriers), responses from the carriers and the data in a template (customization depends on client plan types, funding, rate structure, etc), and reviews the transparency documents Ensure compliance with professional standards including use of templates, client calendar, peer review, and transparency. Peer review the information, analyze and interpret the results, edits and finalize the executive summary report, and send this report to the client. Establish necessary carrier/vendor relationships with appropriate contacts to serve clients in handling all administration (eligibility, claims, billing, plan implementation, contracts, plan changes and necessary amendments). Demonstrate project management skills and manages the quality and timeliness of deliverables and delegates to and reviews project work of more junior colleagues.
What you need to have:


Business Degree or equivalent 3-5 years’ experience in a similar role within a Health & related benefits environment Intermediate MS Office applications skills:  Excel, PowerPoint
Fluency in English & French


Excellent communication and business partnering skills
Eager to exchange, collaborate and work in a multinational network and a global company Think outside of the box and a can-do positive attitude
Why join our team:


We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders. We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues, clients and communities. Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well-being.

Marsh, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is the world’s top insurance broker and risk advisor. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit marsh.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.

Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Tangier TFZ Plant
Driving the future of automotive. We’re Lear For You.
Company Overview
Lear, a global automotive technology leader in Seating and E-Systems, enables superior in-vehicle experiences for consumers around the world. Our diverse team of more than 165,000 talented employees in 37 countries is driven by a commitment to innovation, operational excellence, and sustainability. Lear is Making every drive better™ by providing the technology for safer, smarter, and more comfortable journeys. Lear, headquartered in Southfield, Michigan, serves every major automaker in the world and ranks #186 on the Fortune 500. Further information about Lear is available at lear.com, or follow us on Twitter @LearCorporation
Lear has been operating in Morocco since 2003, offering a wide range of products and demonstrating strong expertise in electrical distribution systems, electronics, surface materials, and seating JIT(Just-in-Time).  With its 17 cutting-edge production and engineering sites located in Rabat, Tangier, Kenitra, and Meknes, Lear Morocco has become a major and significant player in the industry employing over 19,000 diverse & talented team members.
Lear Morocco has been certified as a Top Employer for 3 consecutive years, in recognition of its unwavering commitment to operational excellence, innovation, and fostering supportive work environment.
Position Overview :
We are a highly skilled Industrial Engineer, for planning and managing product industrialization, assuring accurate data for manufacturing, focused on manufacturing continuous improvement in a high growth environment. Contribute to the plant objectives achievement in term of security, quality, Delivery and CI.
Key Skills :
Provide support in DFMs and planning phase of new production lines, as well as ensuring a correct project industrialization for smooth new launches by meeting each project milestone defined.
Ensure related data verification (Drawing, UCS, APD, CL, Electrical test Program, BOM)
Elaborate feasibility analysis for engineering changes.
Coordinate the Pre-Serial trials.
Coordinate with all teams and suppliers to success new projects launches.
Support innovation and ensure technology evolution on processes and production equipements, executing innovation projects with new concepts in line with Factory 4.0 strategy.
Actively participating in general engineering tasks (CI, 5S /LPA audits.)
Participate to all workshops to improve Plant indicators.
To be successful for this role:
Master’s or bachelor’s Engineering Degree. 2-3 years min experience in manufacturing wiring Industry. Effective communication skills. Fluent in English, both written and spoken. A proactive personality, demonstrating initiative. Knowledge/Understanding of wiring manufacturing. Microsoft office skills (Excel, PPT, …).
Why Lear
We offer a fantastic place to work, opportunity to grow and being part of a company who places its people first.
What We Offer
Competitive Salary, Competitive social perks including: + Medical insurance
+ Social security benefits,
+ Transportation allowance,
+ Canteen in site
Paid Vacations Flexible working hours, Access to Learning and development opportunities Opportunities to give back to the community Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world
Lear Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse workplace.
Applicants must submit their resumes for consideration using our applicant tracking system. Due to the high volume of applications received, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies, or similar, will not be paid a fee and will become the property of Lear Corporation.

titre: Trade Marketing, Digital and Operations Manager NWA
intro:
Galderma is the emerging pure-play dermatology category leader, present in approximately 90 countries. We deliver an innovative, science-based portfolio of premium flagship brands and services that span the full spectrum of the fast-growing dermatology market through Injectable Aesthetics, Dermatological Skincare and Therapeutic Dermatology. Since our foundation in 1981, we have dedicated our focus and passion to the human body's largest organ - the skin - meeting individual consumer and patient needs with superior outcomes in partnership with healthcare professionals. Because we understand that the skin, we are in shapes our lives, we are advancing dermatology for every skin story.

We look for people who focus on getting results, embrace learning and bring a positive energy. They must combine initiative with a sense of teamwork and collaboration. Above all, they must be passionate about doing something meaningful for consumers, patients, and the healthcare professionals we serve every day. We aim to empower each employee and promote their personal growth while ensuring business needs are met now and into the future. Across our company, we embrace diversity and respect the dignity, privacy, and personal rights of every employee.

At Galderma, we actively give our teams reasons to believe in our bold ambition to become the leading dermatology company in the world. With us, you have the ultimate opportunity to gain new and challenging work experiences and create an unparalleled, direct impact.

Trade Marketing, Digital and Operations Manager NWA

Morocco, Casablanca
description:
Job Description

Responsible for developing and executing marketing strategies that drive product demand at the retail level. This role involves collaborating with sales teams, retailers, and distributors to enhance product visibility and maximize sales. The role will optimize channel partnerships with a focus on customer channels such as pharmacies, ensuring seamless implementation of agreed point-of-sale (POS) activities in alignment with Galderma Global guidelines. This role involves overseeing various digital marketing channels, analyzing performance metrics, and ensuring the alignment of digital initiatives with business objectives of the Cluster in alignment with Galderma Global to enhance overall customer experience.

Duties & Responsibilities

Manage Channel Partnerships:

Develop collaborative strategies with partners to effectively promote products and services to customers. Monitor localization of this strategy by distributor to main channels: pharmacies, etc.

Ensure Implementation of POS Activities:

Oversee the execution of agreed point-of-sale (POS) activities according to Galderma Global guidelines, ensuring consistency and alignment with brand standards.

Monitor POS initiatives to track effectiveness and adjustments in collaboration with Galderma distributors as necessary to optimize results.

Work closely with Galderma Global and Region e-commerce and digital teams to integrate channel partnership strategies with e-retailers or other POS.

Coordinate efforts with Cluster Team to ensure synergy and alignment of objectives across the organization.

Organize Trade Promotional Activities:

Create, adapt and implement comprehensive trade marketing strategies that align with the company’s overall marketing goals.

Design and execute promotional campaigns, including in-store displays, product sampling, and point-of-sale materials to drive product visibility.

Conduct market research to identify trends, customer preferences, and competitive activities to inform trade marketing decisions.

Work closely with sales distributor teams to develop tailored strategies for specific retailers and channels.

Monitor and analyze the effectiveness of trade marketing initiatives, using metrics to assess performance and make data-driven adjustments.

Tracking of Promotional Spend vs allocated budgets

Digital Marketing Strategy:

Create and execute comprehensive digital marketing strategies, including SEO, SEM, email marketing, social media, and content marketing.

Plan, launch, and manage digital marketing campaigns across multiple platforms to drive brand awareness, engagement, and conversions.

Monitor and analyze the performance of digital marketing campaigns using analytics tools and provide regular reports with insights and recommendations for improvement.

Oversee the creation and distribution of digital content, ensuring it aligns with the brand's voice and objectives.


Stay up to date with the latest digital marketing trends, tools, and best practices, and implement innovative strategies to keep the company ahead of the competition.

Minimum Requirements

Master’sdegree in marketing, Digital Media and Communication

Min 5 years’ experience in trade & digital marketing with a strong track record of successful campaign management and performance analysis.

Proven success track record

Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms (e.g., Google Analytics)Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, excellent communication and negotiation abilities, and proficiency in relevant software and tools.

Strong ability to analyze market data and derive actionable insights.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Ability to adapt to changing market conditions and retail environments.

Strong Collaboration and team spirit skills

English, French and Arabic

What we offer in return

You will be working for an organization that embraces diversity & inclusion and believe we will deliver better outcomes by reflecting the perspectives of our diverse customer base.

You will receive a competitive compensation package with bonus structure and extended benefit package.

You will be joining a growing company that believes in ownership from day one where everyone is empowered to grow and to take accountability.

Next Steps

Please apply with an English language CV.

If your profile is a match, we will invite you for a first virtual conversation with the recruiter.

The next step is a virtual conversation with the hiring manager. 

The final step is a panel conversation with the extended team.

Our people make a difference

At Galderma, you’ll work with people who are like you. And people that are different. We value what every member of our team brings. Professionalism, collaboration, and a friendly, supportive ethos is the perfect environment for people to thrive and excel in what they do.

intro:
Job Purpose
To achieve commercial objectives in the assigned area/territory from different channels, building effective business relationships, enhancing brand visibility, and promoting company’s products and services. To achieve targets, carry marketing campaigns and promotions, and increase the market share of the company ensuring productivity is in line with set measures and company’s adopted policies and procedures



Key Result Responsibilities
1.    Achieves and exceeds the set sales targets in the assigned area/territory; constantly reviews financial data to evaluate performance; identifies shortages, determines root causes, recommends changes to Sales Manager, and implements corrective measures accordingly.
2.    Identifies new opportunities to maximize sales adopting different channels such as existing/new travel agencies, corporates and online portals in the assigned area.
3.    Carries field visits to identify key contacts and decision makers in travel agencies; makes appointments and conducts meetings to educate and influence them promote Air Arabia products and services.
4.    Develops/maintains effective business relationships with travel agencies, GSAs, government departments, ministries, tourism companies, as well as individual agents and trade companies, to increase distribution, enhance business and grow sales. 
5.    Builds/maintains rapport with stakeholders and key customers in the respective area with an accurate database.
6.    Conducts field visits, bench-mark analysis to keep abreast with competitors’ position, market conditions, and customer needs affecting market trends.
7.    Prepares timely sales performance reports for the respective Manager to agree on necessary action and ensure required load factors.
8.    Recognizes the unique needs of the assigned territory versus Air Arabia products and services; evaluates flights and fares with Sales Manager/Revenue Management Team, identifies new route opportunities and recommends the same to respective Manager with a proper business case. 
9.    Provides support and necessary guidance/training to sales agents on new products, systems and preferred sales techniques needed to promote Air Arabia in the respective area.  
10.    Collaborates with Sales Manager, Marketing &Corporate Communications, to coordinate marketing campaigns and activities such as roadshows, trade presentations, and FAM trips to ensure increased branding visibility.
11.     Liaises with the E-Business team to promote online sales and increase ancillary revenue through directed sales activities.
12.    Performs other tasks as assigned by Line Manager



Qualifications (Academic, training, languages)
Minimum Bachelor’s degree in management or equivalent.
Moroccan Nationality is a must
Fluent in French and English


Work Experience
1-2 years of related sales experience, preferably in Aviation/Airline or tourism industry, experience with low-cost airline is a plus. Additional qualification in Aviation/IATA/Tourism is a plus.
Possesses effective persuasive sales and marketing skills and techniques.
Proven skills in analyzing data, identifying pitfalls and recommending effective solutions.
Cost-oriented, possesses effective persuasive, negotiation, problem solving and decision-making skills.
Employs a balance of technical expertise, and interpersonal relations to execute new initiatives that support company’s objectives.
Capable of understanding market needs, trends, and planning accordingly.
Capable of developing reports, comparison sheets, and charts as well as utilizing statistics to identify trends and support the revenue team with recommendations.
Capable of developing and conducting power point presentations to clients.
Demonstrates the ability to contribute and successfully deliver against business strategy and set KPIs.

Principales responsabilités

Renseigner la data base réglementaire et assurer le dispatch des dossiers réglementaires auprès de la filiale

Renseigner la data base avec les dates de soumission des dossiers et approbation des autorités

Assurer le suivi auprès de la filiale pour la soumission des dossiers et le retour des autorités.

Assurer la coordination avec le Regulatory  site officer du sous-traitant.

Rédaction de procédures et instructions liées à l’activité de production dans l’atelier « APS » avec les flux entrant et sortant, scope Qualité / Production

Réalisation de la readiness process de l’atelier de production  

 Initiation et traitement des déviations,

Suivi des plans d’actions issus de la readiness process de l’atelier APS ,

Préparation de reporting d’activité.

Implémentation des outils électroniques pour la gestion de la Qualité (logiciels, application).

Niveau d'éducation

·Formation scientifique, (Pharmacien, Ingénieur, master en Qualité ).

Expérience requise

·2 ans minimum en Management de la Qualité.

Connaissances demandées

·Bonne connaissance des BPF, réglementation,

- Procédés de fabrication et de conditionnement,

·Assurance Qualité en Industrie pharmaceutique,

·Connaissances réglementaires

Compétences techniques

·Capacité à rédiger des documents (SOP, Protocole, Rapport...)

·Sens d’analyse / investigation

·Sens de l’organisation

·Bonne maîtrise de l'informatique (logiciel, Excel, PowerPoint)

·Bonne maîtrise de l'anglais (écrit et parlé)

Compétence générale

·Capacité à apprendre rapidement et développer une autonomie

·Capacité à communiquer de manière efficace et efficiente avec d'autres fonctions.

·Capacité à gérer efficacement plusieurs priorités simultanément

Pursue progress, discover extraordinary
Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action (Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities) employer, 
If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com.

They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.
Primary country and city: Poland (PL) || Krakow
Job details: Developer
About this opportunity
We are now looking for a Dallas System Verification Engineer to maintain our Packet Core Load Test Tool in high quality standard.
We adapt to Lean and Agile ways of working. We organize in multi-functional development teams in which continuous improvement, innovation and knowledge sharing is part of the daily work.
What you will do 
•    Secure the Packet Core Load Test Tools' release on time with system test regression testing
•    Perform End-to-end testing: test analysis, test case/ tool/ script design and test case execution and result reporting
•    Troubleshooting and Trouble Report writing.
•    Support for internal users via Service Desk ticket.
•    Maintain the Continuous Integration Toolkit in good shape.
•    Drive the improvements on test efficiency and effective.
•    Support channel for external users globally and take the comments back to improve our Test Tool or organization.
You will bring
•    Master or Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Telecommunication, Information Technology, Electronics or equivalent formal education
•    Min 3 years of working experience of 3GPP and TCP/IP
•    Solid knowledge in 2G/3G/4G/5G Packet Core system architecture
•    Good knowledge in Linux or Unix (Solaris)
•    Result oriented, flexible and innovative.
•    Learning new technology quickly and apply to work tasks.
•    Willing to accept challenges
•    Fluent in English, both spoken and written, and able to express own thinking clearly
•    Be initiative and accountable
•    Good communication and collaboration skills
Nice to have:
•    Basic programming experience in Python
•    Basic integration knowledge of cloud native and Kubernetes
Role requires relocation to
Krakow, Poland

Driving the future of automotive. We’re Lear For You.
Company Overview
Lear, a global automotive technology leader in Seating and E-Systems, enables superior in-vehicle experiences for consumers around the world. Our diverse team of more than 165,000 talented employees in 37 countries is driven by a commitment to innovation, operational excellence, and sustainability. Lear is Making every drive better™ by providing the technology for safer, smarter, and more comfortable journeys. Lear, headquartered in Southfield, Michigan, serves every major automaker in the world and ranks #186 on the Fortune 500. Further information about Lear is available at lear.com, or follow us on Twitter @LearCorporation
Lear has been operating in Morocco since 2003, offering a wide range of products and demonstrating strong expertise in electrical distribution systems, electronics, surface materials, and seating JIT(Just-in-Time). With its 17 cutting-edge production and engineering sites located in Rabat, Tangier, Kenitra, and Meknes, Lear Morocco has become a major and significant player in the industry employing over 19,000 diverse & talented team members.
Lear Morocco has been certified as a Top Employer for 3 consecutive years, in recognition of its unwavering commitment to operational excellence, innovation, and fostering supportive work environment.
Key Skills :
Follow the homologation of raw materials. Guaranteed the Incoming inspection process & record data Follow the supplier Qualities notifications Supplier metrics tracking Supplier Audit Supplier PPAP review & approve Supplier improvement program Roadmaps IMDS approval review Manage the SQA team Manage escalation process CS1 & CS2 coordination,deployment & control Create the incoming instructions Responsible for leading the SQA activities so that all quality functions during the design, development , launch and production of parts, in his area of responsibility; are completed on schedules Conduct and analyses quality claims suppliers Have the authority to stop production and shipment in case of non-conformity Has ability to perform and assist with all SQA techniques Monitors and participates in the improvement of product process quality Develops and presents SQA presentations materials Lear s quality and environmental policies and procedures Learns the rules; understands them; follows them, and participates in the energy, environment, safety and health program (e.g. planned inspections; energy,environment, safety and health suggestions; energy, environment, safety and health management systems, etc.). Reports all incidents, accidents and unsafe conditions and acts to supervisors or uses the system set up to facilitate reporting. Takes personal responsibility for keeping selves, co-workers, and equipment free of hazards. Participates on saving energy and proposes suggestions to control it. Have the authority to stop production and shipment in case of non-conformity
To be successful for this role:
University degree (Master's) – Electrical, Industrial Engineering Major 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role Customer oriented Knowledge in electronic and development in HW or SW Problem solving methodology knowledge. Quality management in automotive industry Analytical and problem solving skills French & English-speaking skills are mandatory
Why Lear
We offer a fantastic place to work, opportunity to grow and being part of a company who places its people first.
What We Offer
Competitive Salary, Competitive social perks including: Medical insurance Social security benefits, Transportation allowance, Canteen in site Paid Vacations Flexible working hours, Access to Learning and development opportunities Opportunities to give back to the community Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world
Lear Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse workplace.

Job Purpose
Responsible for providing support across various human resources functions, ensuring smooth operations and timely execution of HR tasks. This role involves assisting in recruitment, onboarding, preparing documentation, employee engagement activities, and updating HR records, while following up with departments to ensure that HR processes are completed efficiently and in accordance with company policies. The HR Executive works closely with the other HR team members and department managers to support HR initiatives and ensure consistent communication and coordination across the organization.



Key Result Responsibilities
Manages the full recruitment process for assigned / junior positions, including sourcing, job posting, application screening, interview scheduling, and conducting competency-based selection processes in partnership with HR and Line Managers.
Conducts pre-screening, shortlisting, reference checks, and employment verification for selected candidates, ensuring compliance and eligibility.
Communicates interview outcomes and handles candidate follow-up, preparing and negotiating employment offers in line with company policies and compensation structures.
Organize the logistics for new employee orientations and ensure proper documentation is collected.
Assist in the offboarding process by gathering exit documents, conducting exit interviews for junior positions, and updating relevant records.
Maintain employee records in the HR system and ensure the accurate entry of all data such as employee status changes, promotions, and terminations.
Assist in generating regular reports (e.g., recruitment status).
Respond to employee inquiries regarding HR policies, employee benefits, and other employee-related matters.
Assist with organizing and coordinating employee engagement initiatives, events, and company-wide communications.
Provide support in addressing employee concerns, grievances and disciplinary processes
Ensure adherence to company HR policies, procedures, and employment laws.


Qualifications (Academic, training, languages)
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
Moroccan Nationality is a must
Good English and French 


Work Experience
Minimum 5 years of HR experience in any service industry, particularly in recruitment and employee relations in a mid-sized organization operating on a regional/multinational level.
Strong organizational and multitasking abilities to handle recruitment, onboarding, and offboarding processes.
Competency in pre-screening, shortlisting, and reference checks.
Familiarity with HR systems, data entry, and report generation.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills for liaising with candidates, employees, and department managers.
Basic understanding of employment laws and HR policies.
Attention to detail and the ability to maintain accurate records.
Discretion in handling confidential HR matters.

description:
Job Description:


Arrow’s enterprise computing solutions (ECS) business is a global technology enablement company that brings innovative IT solutions to market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting and channel enablement services to the world’s leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners that serve commercial and government markets.


##
What you will be doing:


Primary responsibility is to provide comprehensive technical support for customer design and system development. Key areas of responsibility are:
● Demand Creation: Focus on customer presentations, semiconductor product introductions, and technical sales training for the local Arrow Electronics sales team.
● Account Management: Identify selling opportunities through a planned discovery process. Proficient in understanding of customer's needs and how to translate those needs to Arrow requirements or opportunities
● Relationships: Must be able to build relationships and remain current on product knowledge and/or gaining technical certifications. Attend supplier training events to keep up to date on product line. Requires proficiency in supplier databases and keep design registration information accurate. Remain informed on current related technologies in customer base, and attend training as needed.
This job profile requires the assignment and participation in a sales compensation plan. A portion of OTE will be variable and tied to specific sales-related goals as set forth by Arrow.
More about the position:


● Requires in-depth knowledge and experience
● Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective using existing solutions
● Works independently; receives minimal guidance
● Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience
● Represents the level at which career may stabilize for many years or even until retirement
● Contributes to process improvements
● Typically resolves problems using existing solutions
● Provides informal guidance to junior staff
● Works with minimal guidance
What We Are Looking For:


Experience in the IT sector in technical or engineering functions Strong customer orientation with a sense of innovation and technology; A real and innate passion to learn new technologies, a strong attitude for new challenges; Ability to identify and resolve partners issues with excelling at prioritization of the workload;
Fluency in Dutch and English.

What’s In It For You:


Growth & learning opportunities; Certifications Challenging & diverse tasks; Open Corporate Culture with a modern and dynamic work environment; Safe and trustful employment; Participating in technology fairs and events;

description:
Job Description

Technical expert that will drive late-stage process development activities of novel antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs).  Independently identify, develop, and execute laboratory experiments to address critical project needs.  Continuously seek to improve existing laboratory methods and processes.  Read and adapt literature to accomplish assignments.  Demonstrate mastery of a broad range of experimental techniques and methods of data analysis.  Collaborate effectively with cross-functional groups ensure robust process scale-up and tech transfer to manufacturing sites.

Responsibilities:

List up to 10 main responsibilities for the job. Include information about the accountability and scope.

•Independently design and conduct critical experiments that further project goals.

•Implement and may innovate new experimental protocols/techniques.

•Understand the goal and maintain a high proficiency in his/her projects as well as the overall

program.

•Interpret results and draw conclusions from own multistage experiments, note significant

deviations, then suggest, design, and pursue relevant experiments.

•Understand relevant scientific literature and apply theoretical framework to solving problems within

scientific discipline in a timely manner.

•Perform routine and complex tasks competently and independently and generate reliable and

consistent results.

•Impact projects mostly through lab and/or pilot plant based activities.

•Responsible for compliance with all applicable Corporate and Divisional policies and procedures.

•Understand and adhere to corporate standards regarding code of conduct, safety, appropriate

handling of materials, controlled drug and radioactive compounds, GxP compliance, and animal care

where applicable.


Qualifications

•Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent education with typically 5 years of experience, or Master’s Degree

or equivalent education with typically two years of experience.

•Theoretical and practical knowledge to carry out the job functions.


Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: 


The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. 


Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.

Babel est une multinationale espagnole qui compte à peu près de 3000 employés dans le monde présente déjà dans 4 continents qui offre des services en technologies nouvelles visant à accompagner les grandes organisations dans leur processus de transformation digitale.

Quel est notre plan stratégique ?

Nous regardons vers l'avenir ! Notre plan stratégique Hyperspace 2029 promet d'être un voyage passionnant, plein d'opportunités de croissance et de développement professionnel. Atteindre un chiffre d'affaires de 1 milliard d'euros, un défi que nous sommes sûrs de relever grâce à la collaboration et au talent de notre équipe, sera une autre histoire de succès que nous écrirons ensemble.

Quel profil nous recherchons?

Professionnel certifié, doté d’une grande expérience et d’une vision globale des architectures réseaux, capable de concevoir, déployer et optimiser des réseaux de communication complexes (voix, données, sécurité périmétrique, etc.).

Missions principales :
Modéliser la cartographie technique (HDL,LDL) du SI, en garantissant la performance, la sécurité et la scalabilité des infrastructures.
Formaliser les documents d’architecture technique , d’infrastructure et des flux de donnée
Accompagner la migration vers des architectures cibles et l’optimisation des performances SI.
Veiller à l’interopérabilité et à la résilience des systèmes en fonction des évolutions technologiques et des contraintes métiers.
Assurer une veille technologique continue et proposer des améliorations techniques adaptées aux enjeux de la Banque.
Compétences requises :
Expertise technique en réseau, sécurité et en infrastructures virtualisées (Docker, Kubernetes).
Connaissance approfondie des systèmes d’exploitation (Windows/Linux), bases de données (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) et des technologies middleware.
Maîtrise des principes DevOps et des outils CI/CD
Expérience en cybersécurité et résilience IT (gestion des vulnérabilités, PRA/PCA,
Forte capacité d’analyse et de résolution de problèmes techniques complexes.
Forte compétence de communication et de rédaction en langue française

Expertise de plus de 10 ans dans le domaine d’architecture technique

Certification en réseau et sécurité

Que proposons-nous ?

Babel, the great way to achieve the success.


Veux-tu faire partie d'une équipe en expansion, engagée et innovante qui fait l'histoire chaque jour ?  Chez Babel, nous t'accompagnons sur le chemin du succès.  Nous croyons au talent des personnes et nous voulons le valoriser en vous offrant un excellent environnement de travail basé sur la collaboration et la solidarité.
Travailler chez Babel, c'est bien plus que travailler dans une entreprise, c'est rejoindre une équipe de personnes avec une mission partagée et un modèle d'entreprise axé sur les valeurs.
De plus,

Nous investissons dans la formation de nos Babelievers.
Nous investissons dans ta santé physique et émotionnelle.  (Assurance Maladie Privée / Assurance Vie, Plan de retraite).
Nous investissons également dans ton temps libre (Team building, Happy Day, AfterWork, Team Day.. )
Nous participons à la croissance de l'entreprise et reconnaissons la contribution de chaque personne (Prime de Bénéfices).
Nous mettons l'accent sur le travail avec les dernières technologies et les projets innovants, mais surtout, nous accompagnons la transformation numérique et rapprochons la technologie de la société.
Acceptes-tu le défi ? Nous t'attendons !

Chez Babel, nous favorisons un environnement de travail basé sur le respect de nos professionnels, le développement professionnel et la promotion de l'égalité des chances sans aucune discrimination.

Conformément à la législation en vigueur en matière de protection des données, nous vous informons que le GRUPO BABEL est responsable de vos données personnelles (voir les entreprises dans la politique de confidentialité), et qu'il les utilisera pour gérer vos processus de sélection, actuels et futurs, ainsi que pour les autres finalités décrites sur le site web. Ce traitement est basé sur le consentement du candidat. Les données personnelles collectées ne seront en aucun cas transférées à des tiers, sauf en cas d'obligations légales expresses. Vous pouvez exercer vos droits en matière de protection des données à l'adresse suivante : data.protection@babelgroup.com. Toutes les informations sur la politique de confidentialité sont disponibles sur notre site web.

For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.
description:
Job Description

Key Responsibilities

Manage antibody production campaigns in collaboration w/therapeutic areas, incl. data mgmt, presentation & coordination of assays to be run.
Execute high throughput molecular cloning & antibody production workflows using automation technologies.
Lead dvlpmt of new automated liquid handling or analytical workflows.
Characterize therapeutic proteins using MS, SEC, DSF, ELISA, SDS-PAGE, FACS.

Qualifications

Education & Experience

Must have a Master's in biology, biochemistry or related field & 2 yr research or industry exp in:

(i) Applying molecular biology techniques (PCR, molecular cloning);

(ii) Utilizing sequence analysis tools (Vector NTI, Geneious, Sequencher), graphing software (GraphPad Prism) &statistical analysis (Python);

(iii) Applying cell culture (bacteria, mammalian) & protein purification techniques (AKTA, Protein Maker, Assay MAP);

(iv) Conducting analytical characterization of therapeutic proteins (MS, SEC, DSF, ELISA, SDS-PAGE); and

(v) Conducting statistical (Python) and structure-based (PyMol, Schrodinger Bioluminate) analysis of protein structure and function to predict liabilities and features of interest in antibodies.

Of experience required, must also have 1 yr research or industry exp utilizing and developing methods on liquid handling platforms (Hamilton, Tecan, Dynamic Devices).

Experience may be gained concurrently.


Additional Information

Salary Range: $104,200 - $138,500 per year.

Apply online at https://careers.abbvie.com/en. Refer to Req ID: REF39458D. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.  This job is eligible to participate in our short-term and long-term incentive programs.

intro:
At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

Could you be the full-time Project Supply Chain Leader in Fez/Morocco  we’re looking for?

Your future role

Take on a new challenge and apply your supply chain and logistics expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You’ll work alongside dynamic and collaborative teammates.

You'll play a key role in ensuring seamless supply chain operations throughout the lifecycle of our projects. Day-to-day, you’ll work closely with teams across the business (tender, industrial, and supplier management teams), manage supply chain processes, and ensure alignment with quality, cost, and delivery (QCD) objectives, and much more.

You’ll specifically take care of designing supply chain networks during the tender phase, securing project ramp-ups, and managing changes and crises during the project lifecycle, but also coordinating supply chain activities during project closures.

We’ll look to you for:

Designing supply chain processes based on tender requirements and committing to direct costs (e.g., direct hours, packaging costs).

Setting up and synchronizing supply chain processes with industrial requirements during ramp-up phases.

Driving key activities to ensure supplier deliveries, logistics flows, stock policies, and systems meet QCD objectives.

Identifying and managing supplier risks, including capacity assessments and logistics specifications for business awards.

Coordinating supply chain activities related to planning changes, supplier modifications, or technical updates.

Supporting supply chain teams in resolving critical delivery issues and anticipating material shortages.

Minimizing costs and obsolete inventories during project closures while securing the end of production.


All about you

We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:

Master’s degree in Supply Chain or Logistics.

Experience in supply chain operations, preferably in supplier/customer relationships, project management, or industrial settings.

Fluent in both French and English.

Knowledge of ERP material management (e.g., master data, purchase orders) or ERP architecture understanding (e.g., BOM, NCR).

Ability to deal quickly and effectively with a variety of topics.

Strong analytical skills to summarize and focus on critical issues.

A results-driven mindset with a proactive approach to challenges.


Things you’ll enjoy Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:

Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines

Work with new security standards for rail signalling

Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues

Contribute to innovative projects

Utilise our flexible and inclusive working environment

Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries

Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning

Progress towards leadership roles or specialized supply chain functions

Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, pension)

You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

Important to note

As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63  countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

·         Participe à la création des socles techniques, des POCs et aux développements complexes
·         Est le garant que la solution développée est conforme avec l’architecture et les normes et standards du groupe

To be in charge of an area of the warehouse (incoming, shipping, kitting & mirror area)

Main responsibilities:

Ensure that employees operate in an environment that complies with company Health, Safety and Environmental policies:
Know and follow all safety, environmental and emergency procedures
Respect the safety conditions to handle goods, trolleys etc.
Actively participate in all aspects of safety including reporting of near misses and meetings
Notify Warehouse Manager of all safety, site keeping or maintenance issues that are found during inspection that require assistance
Ensure the storage of materials, guarantee the quantities stored and the correct storage conditions
Ensure the material availability, integrity & delivery on time on production line
Manage the physical material flows of his area (reception, put away, kitting, mirror area, shipping) to always keep physical and system flows aligned
Ensure the ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) solution is implemented and correctly used by Logistics operators
Work closely with Warehouse Key User to manage the stock in the ERP system according to the core model and to train Logistics operators
Monitor & challenge the performance of his area activity through Key Performance Indicators
Actively contributes to the Continuous Improvement activities & APSYS roadmap (APSYS=Alstom Transport Production System) on his own area
Management:

Provide a long-term vision to the team, set yearly objectives and targets, support and coach in achieving these targets and objectives, perform performance appraisals, reward and recognize merits, set and follow up team members development plans and induction program for newcomers
Ensure Logistics Operators follow ALSTOM each warehouse processes
Manage Logistics Operators & aligned team members activities to the warehouse workload
Operational activities:

Participate to the warehouse layout and optimize the storage space
Contribute to the implementation of mirror area in the warehouse to optimize line feeding activities (Kanban flow, sequence …)
Manage at operations level his area: material receipt, inbound transportation, stock entry, picking and kitting, line feeding, packing, shipping, outbound transportation, inventory accuracy, scrap process
Respect any specific storage regulations (chemicals, battery, …)
Ensure the continually improvement of the warehouse organisation & processes
In case of 3PL (logistic activities totally or partially outsourced):

Main responsibilities (towards 3PL):

Ensure that the 3PL and his employees operates in an environment that complies with Alstom’s Health, Safety and Environmental policies.
If the 3PL works in Alstom’s ERP, ensure that is correctly implemented and used by the 3PL
Participate in all monthly, weekly and daily meetings with the 3PL
Management (towards 3PL):

Manage 3PLs that are in charge of the external stock (KPIs review, steering committee, monitor activities, …)
Operational activities (towards 3PL):

Guarantee follow-up and performance of 3PL activities through KPIs
Analyse the Root Causes of any logistic issues and agree with the internal stakeholders and the Management of the 3PL on corrective actions. Follow up on these actions and participate in their realization
Competencies and skils

University diploma in Finance/Accouting or equivalent... 
Knowledge of basic accounting principles for recording financial transactions
Understanding of the applicable international and/or national accounting standards
Ability to analyze and interpret financial data and ratios to detect inconsistencies and errors
Experience in invoice verification and related problem resolution
Proficiency in SAP and Excel software
Knowledge of procedures and legal obligations related to supplier invoicing
