Entité:

Au sein du Groupe, Petit Forestier Digital Solutions est le Centre De Services nearshore du groupe Petit Forestier.

Crée en 2017, PFDS accompagne le groupe dans sa transformation digitale en offrant un catalogue de services complet (Support applicatif et infrastructure multi-niveaux, Développement, administration et maintenance des systèmes d'informations groupe, Test et qualité logicielle, BI et Data Quality, Cyber sécurité, Business Process Outsourcing).

Contexte :

Le groupe Petit Forestier est en forte croissance, à la fois organique et externe avec des acquisitions à l’international. Dans ce contexte, le groupe a lancé un programme ambitieux de transformation (TOM). Il intègre un volet système d’information majeur avec l’implémentation de la solution SAP pour remplacer le cœur du système d’information existant.

Vos principales missions seront:


Gestion d’équipe QA, répartir les tâches et préparer un plan de charge


Superviser les tâches de test durant les différentes phases projet


Garantir l’assurance qualité et définir les meilleurs pratiques sur plusieurs projets en parallèle


Conception, rédaction et maintenance des cahiers de tests en coordination avec les Chefs de projets et Product Owners.


Amélioration continue des process QA


Participer à l’élaboration de la stratégie qualité de l’équipe.


Participation active dans l'industrialisation des tests


Exécuter ces tests avec comme objectif de détecter un maximum d’anomalies


Gérer de bout en bout les defects associés aux cas de tests (suivi correction, planning...)


Mener de bout en bout les compagnes de test durant les phases projet


Rédiger des comptes rendus d’activités et des rapports de tests


Profil recherché :


De formation de niveau Bac+5 dans une école d’ingénieur (EMSI, ENSIAS, INSEA, INPT, EMI…) ou master universitaire


Minimum 5ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire


Une certification ISTQB (Fondation, Avanced, Test Manager, Agile Testing) est un atout.


Qualités requises :


Connaissances d’outils de gestion de tests et suivi d’anomalies de type JIRA, XRAY


Expérience en automatisation et développement des scripts automatiques



Être flexible, organisé et méthodique


Capacité de gérer une équipe


Compréhension des enjeux du respect de la stratégie de test


Bonne communication orale et écrite en Français. L’anglais est un plus


Soucis du détail et rigueur permettant d’assurer la qualité des applications testées

titre: Administrateur Rôles et Autorisations SAP H/F
intro:
PETIT FORESTIER est le leader de la location de matériel frigorifique en Europe.

Créé en 1907 son histoire familiale lui confère une singularité sur le marché qui lui permet d'afficher des chiffres en progression constante : 940 millions d'euros de Chiffre d'Affaires, 5'100 collaborateurs, 300 sites répartis dans 20 pays.

Au sein du Groupe, Petit Forestier Digital Solutions est le Centre De Services nearshore du groupe Petit Forestier.

Crée en 2017, PFDS accompagne le groupe dans sa transformation digitale en offrant un catalogue de services complet (Support applicatif et infrastructure multi-niveaux, Développement, administration et maintenance des systèmes d'informations groupe, Test et qualité logicielle, BI et Data Quality, Cyber sécurité, Business Process Outsourcing)

Pour cette entité, nous recherchons un " Administrateur Rôles et Autorisations SAP (H/F)".

Contexte :
Le groupe Petit Forestier est en forte croissance, à la fois organique et externe avec des acquisitions à l’international. Dans ce contexte, le groupe a lancé un programme ambitieux de transformation (TOM). Il intègre un volet système d’information majeur avec l’implémentation de la solution SAP pour remplacer le cœur du système d’information existant.

Petit Forestier est accompagné d’une assistance à maîtrise d’ouvrage pour construire un modèle opérationnel cible, ainsi que d’un intégrateur SAP pour construire la solution.

Le périmètre SAP couvre les achats, la finance, les contrats, la facturation, la maintenance et la gestion de flotte.

Quel sera votre rôle ?

Vous êtes l'interlocuteur privilégié/Référant pour l'administration des droits SAP sur différents modules : S/4 HANA (FI-CO, SD, MM), FSM (Fleet System Management), SAP Concur

Activités principales :

Définition et maintien de la matrice des rôles et autorisations selon les évolutions des processus métiers en collaboration avec les responsables fonctionnels et experts SAP
Conception, mise en œuvre et évolution des profils utilisateur.
Gestion des rôles simples, dérivés et composites.
Garantir la conformité et le respect des normes
Suivre l'application des notes SAP sécurité en lien avec les autorisations et les outils SAP
Auditer et optimiser les règles liées aux paramètres de sécurité SAP
Mise en place des tests d'intrusion et des contrôles de vulnérabilités du code
Suivi de la sécurisation des bases HANA en termes de gestion des droits et contrôles d’actions sensibles
Assistance aux utilisateurs pour les questions relatives aux autorisations.
Profil et qualifications :

De formation supérieure Bac+5 en informatique
Vous avez une expérience d’au moins 4 ans dans la gestion des autorisations SAP
Connaissances approfondies des aspects liés à la sécurité (confidentialité, sécurisation des systèmes et administration des rôles) et autres solutions de type SIEM et IAM
Compétences techniques et développements selon les technologies (ex ECC, Solutions Manager, dv HANA, Fiori, S4 et BW4HANA)
Être flexible, organisé et méthodique
Capacité de travailler en autonomie et en équipe
Bonne communication orale et écrite en Français. L’anglais est souhaitable

description:
Job Description:


Contract Manager (Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions)


Under the supervision of the EMEA Legal Counsel Director, the Contract Manager will be responsible for overseeing and managing the entire contract lifecycle with partners, ensuring compliance and alignment with Arrow's policies and standards.
What You Will Be Doing at Arrow:


Manage and oversee contracts with partners, from negotiation through to execution, ensuring each stage aligns with Arrow’s policies and procedures.
Negotiate contracts in coordination with Arrow's legal counsel and internal teams to ensure the best terms for the company.
Collaborate with key internal stakeholders (Sales, Operations, Tax, Compliance, etc.) to gather necessary inputs during the contract negotiation process.
Ensure that all contracts are aligned with Arrow’s internal policies, standards, and guidelines.
Manage the contract signature process in accordance with Arrow's policies and maintain an organized archive of all contracts in the company’s contract database.
Monitor contract renewal dates and provide timely reminders to relevant teams for renewals.
Respond to partners’ RFPs, questionnaires, and general legal requests, ensuring coordination with relevant internal teams.
Track and monitor contractual performance indicators and ensure regular and accurate reporting.
Fluent in English, with at least 5 years of experience in a Contract Manager role for an international company.
The candidate must have a verifiable legal background and be able to negotiate and draft contracts in English.
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities.
As a true business partner for your stakeholders, you understand the group's commercial challenges and provide your expertise with pragmatism and responsiveness, always maintaining a focus on efficiency and meeting deadlines.
Rigor, responsiveness, interpersonal skills, and a strong sense of analysis and synthesis are essential.
Full-time, permanent contract.
Competitive compensation package with comprehensive social benefits: CNSS, CIMR, Health insurance.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment where your contributions will have a meaningful impact.
Opportunity to work within a globally recognized leader in the technology sector, offering growth and career development opportunities.

intro:
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.

Babel est une multinationale espagnole qui compte à peu près de 3000 employés dans le monde présente déjà dans 4 continents qui offre des services en technologies nouvelles visant à accompagner les grandes organisations dans leur processus de transformation digitale.

Quel est notre plan stratégique ?

Nous regardons vers l'avenir ! Notre plan stratégique Hyperspace 2029 promet d'être un voyage passionnant, plein d'opportunités de croissance et de développement professionnel. Atteindre un chiffre d'affaires de 1 milliard d'euros, un défi que nous sommes sûrs de relever grâce à la collaboration et au talent de notre équipe, sera une autre histoire de succès que nous écrirons ensemble.

Quel profil nous recherchons?

Nous recherchons un Développeur iOS Senior passionné et expérimenté pour rejoindre notre équipe. Vous travaillerez sur le développement et l'amélioration d'applications mobiles performantes et innovantes, en utilisant les dernières technologies iOS.

Responsabilités
Concevoir, développer et optimiser des applications iOS natives avec Swift.
Assurer la qualité du code en respectant les bonnes pratiques et les principes de développement.
Collaborer avec les designers, les chefs de projet et les autres développeurs pour proposer la meilleure expérience utilisateur.
Intégrer des API et des services backend.
Réaliser des tests unitaires et assurer la correction des bugs.
Participer aux revues de code et proposer des améliorations.
Rester à jour avec les dernières tendances et évolutions de l’écosystème iOS.
Profil recherché
Expérience de 4 ans ou plus en développement iOS.
Excellente maîtrise de Swift et des frameworks iOS (UIKit, SwiftUI, CoreData, etc.).
Expérience avec les architectures MVVM, VIPER ou Clean Architecture.
Connaissance des outils de CI/CD et des tests automatisés.
Expérience avec les bases de données (CoreData, Realm) et l'intégration d'API REST.
Bonne compréhension des principes UX/UI.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à résoudre des problèmes de manière autonome.
#babel

Que proposons-nous ?

Babel, the great way to achieve the success.


Veux-tu faire partie d'une équipe en expansion, engagée et innovante qui fait l'histoire chaque jour ?  Chez Babel, nous t'accompagnons sur le chemin du succès.  Nous croyons au talent des personnes et nous voulons le valoriser en vous offrant un excellent environnement de travail basé sur la collaboration et la solidarité.
Travailler chez Babel, c'est bien plus que travailler dans une entreprise, c'est rejoindre une équipe de personnes avec une mission partagée et un modèle d'entreprise axé sur les valeurs.
De plus,

Nous investissons dans la formation de nos Babelievers.
Nous investissons dans ta santé physique et émotionnelle.  (Assurance Maladie Privée / Assurance Vie, Plan de retraite).
Nous investissons également dans ton temps libre (Team building, Happy Day, AfterWork, Team Day.. )
Nous participons à la croissance de l'entreprise et reconnaissons la contribution de chaque personne (Prime de Bénéfices).
Nous mettons l'accent sur le travail avec les dernières technologies et les projets innovants, mais surtout, nous accompagnons la transformation numérique et rapprochons la technologie de la société.
Acceptes-tu le défi ? Nous t'attendons !

ABOUT THE ROLE:


Arrow ECS is a specialist IT distributor providing enterprise-class solutions and services focused on data storage, network security, enterprise software, virtualization and access infrastructure.
Working with our channel partners, we optimize the efficiency with which organizations can store, manage, protect and deploy their data, equipping them with secure access to business-critical information at any time, from any location, on any device.
Through close alliances with the world’s leading vendors, we deliver innovative solutions, complemented by an impressive portfolio of expert professional services and IT training. We support our channel partners from initial consultation, planning and design, engineering build through to implementation and post-sales care.
The Operations Administrator role will require the post-holder to eventually provide support to the Operations Specialists on a day to day basis which will entail close liaison between Arrow ECS’s Suppliers and our Sales Team. You have the opportunity to work with a motivated team in collegial atmosphere with possibility for further development within the company.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:


Processing/progressing orders and working closely with the Quote & configuration and Renewals team to check pricing and discounts, etc Purchase order placement Update Customer and Customer Service on PO progress, shipment dates, delivery dates, POD’s Claim procedures Warranty Registrations Reconciliation of invoices Support for all aspects of stock management Claim reconciliation and escalation of anomalies/errors through to resolution. Credit note reconciliation and escalation of anomalies/errors through to resolution. Support for all aspects of stock management
WHAT WE OFFER:


Excellent training opportunities Permanent job contract Private medical healthcare MyBenefit system Fantastic working culture where you can make an impact Nice office facility in an easy-to-reach location Broad selection of teas, coffee and fresh fruits Friendly work atmosphere Casual dress policy Due to the nature of this role flexibility will be required in order to meet the needs of the role especially at month and quarter ends. italie bank holidays will apply.
WHAT WE LOOK FOR:


Previous experience of working in a business service sector (Purchasing Department) will be advantageous, Excellent written italian skills, Honest, hardworking, self motivated, reliable and diligent, Fully accountable and take ownership to resolution, Excellent administration skills, Excellent communication skills, with the ability to liaise with both internal and external contacts at all levels, Able to work as part of a team or on their own initiative, Ability to pay close attention to detail, Able to work towards tight deadlines, Good knowledge of Microsoft packages  – Excel, Word, Microsoft Outlook .

Quality Engineer

Help shape the future of mobility.

Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv’s passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Position Summary

Direct and supervise all product quality control and manufacturing process activities performed by the audit team and issue audit action plans to improve established quality ratios and achieve expected quality.

Your Role

As a Quality  Engineer, you will be in charge of these various accountabilities:

 Ensure the processing of customer complaints in collaboration with other departments;
 Oversee the application of EOS systems and procedures;
 Analyze the customer's product quality requirements;
 Ensure the management of customer complaints;
 Evaluate the manufacturing process in collaboration with the Engineering Department;
 Inform the engineers of the Engineering Department of any anomalies and decide on corrective actions in collaboration with them;
Your Background

Bac+5 / Engineering degree in a technical education (or equivalent)
Advanced English is mandatory
Knowledge of manufacturing process
Strong analytical and synthesis skills
Problem solving techniques
Why join us?

You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health.
Apply today, and together let’s change tomorrow!

Position:AI Automation Specialist (IT Support)Job Description:Job Summary

The AI Automation Specialist (IT Support) is responsible for analyzing operational workflows, and service delivery processes within IT Support and Managed Services. This role identifies opportunities for automation, workflow improvements, and knowledge management enhancements. The analyst collaborates with cross-functional teams to propose, present, and support the implementation of these initiatives, including leveraging AI-driven solutions and automation tools to enhance service efficiency.

Key Responsibilities

Automation & AI Implementation

Identify and prioritize use cases for automation in IT support and managed services.

Collaborate with customer engagement and technical teams to design, implement, and test automation solutions (e.g., chatbots, RPA, AI-assisted ticketing).

Support the training and fine-tuning of generative AI models for knowledge base enhancement and service optimization.


Knowledge Management & Workflow Enhancement

Coordinate the establishment and continuous improvement of knowledge bases to enable self-service and improve resolution times.

Work with subject matter experts (SMEs) to document best practices, troubleshooting guides, and FAQs.

Ensure integration of knowledge management systems with automation and AI tools.


Cross-Team Collaboration & Change Management

 Work with IT, service delivery, and business stakeholders to align automation initiatives with business goals.

Facilitate training sessions and workshops to drive adoption of automation tools and new processes.

Monitor industry trends and emerging technologies to identify opportunities for continuous improvement.

Required Qualifications & Skills

Education & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Process Management, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

3+ years of experience in service operations, IT support, automation, or process improvement roles.

Experience with IT Service Management (ITSM) tools such as ServiceNow, Zendesk, or Jira Service Management.


Technical & Analytical Skills

Strong understanding of workflow automation, AI-driven support tools, and process optimization methodologies.

Familiarity with automation tools such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), chatbot platforms, or AI-driven service solutions.

Ability to analyze and interpret data to drive process improvement recommendations.

Soft Skills & Collaboration

Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Problem-solving mindset with a focus on efficiency and user experience.

Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with AI/ML applications in customer support or managed services.

ITIL certification or experience in IT Service Management frameworks.

Knowledge of scripting languages or low-code automation platforms (e.g., Python, Power Automate, UiPath).

# Responsable Achats F/H
Location : Casablanca
,
Morocco
Required experience : More than 5 years
## Job Description
Safran est un groupe international de haute technologie opérant dans les domaines de l'aéronautique (propulsion, équipements et intérieurs), de l'espace et de la défense.

Safran Aicraft Engines est une société du Groupe Safran. Porté par près de 15 000 collaborateurs répartis sur 31 sites dans 9 pays, Safran Aircraft
Engines (SAE) est un motoriste aéronautique depuis plus de 110 ans. Nous concevons, développons, produisons et commercialisons, seul ou en coopération, des moteurs pour avions civils ou militaires, ainsi que pour les satellites.

Safran Aircraft Engines dispose d'un réseau d'ateliers de maintenance des moteurs civils à travers le monde et propose à ses clients une gamme complète d'interventions : restauration de performances, remplacement de pièces à durée de vie limitée, inspection et maintenance de l'ensemble du moteur et de ses équipements.

Pour faire face à la montée en cadence des maintenances moteur LEAP dans les années à venir, Safran Aircraft Engines Services Casablanca (SAESC) a lancé la construction d'un nouveau shop au Maroc. Notre nouvel atelier situé dans la région de Casablanca-Settat assurera la maintenance de nouveaux types de moteurs d'avions civils (LEAP) qui équipent notamment l'Airbus A320neo et le Boeing 737Max.

Découvrons votre futur poste !

En tant que Responsable Achats, votre objectif sera de piloter et optimiser l'activité achats conformément aux exigences clients et aux objectifs budgétaires, dans le respect des règles compliance Groupe.

Dans ce cadre, vous serez amené(e) à :
- Vérifier l'exécution des demandes d'achats transmises par les prescripteurs dans les délais impartis
- Contrôler le bon suivi des commandes par les acheteurs
- Piloter les indicateurs permettant d'atteindre le niveau de service cible et d'optimiser le niveau de saving
- Alimenter en continu le panel fournisseurs en cohérence avec les besoins de l'entreprise
- Superviser la sélection des fournisseurs, en veillant à l'obtention des meilleurs prix et délais
- Valider les factures fournisseurs, suivre les contrats et s'assurer du respect des engagements
- Identifier et mettre en œuvre les pistes de contractualisation des achats récurrents
- Monitorer les paiements fournisseurs en suivant de près les dettes échues non payées auprès de la direction financière
- Conduire et formaliser l'évaluation annuelle des fournisseurs sur la base des feedbacks des prescripteurs
- Mener des revues périodiques avec les clients internes visant le suivi de l'activité et le réalignement avec les objectifs escomptés (revue contractuelle, priorisation des dossiers en cours, voice of customer, etc.)
- Manager ses équipes dans une optique de travail collaboratif et mettre en œuvre les moyens nécessaires pour favoriser leur développement professionnel
## Job Requirements
Niveau du diplôme : Bac+ 5
Type du diplôme : Ecole de commerce ou d'ingénieur, option achats ou logistique
Expérience globale : 4 à 5 ans d'expérience professionnelle

Votre profil :
Connaissance du process logistique
Règlementations aéronautiques
Gestion de stocks
Gestion d'entrepôt et manutention
Gestion des achats
Connaissance des procédures qualité
Capacité d'analyse et de synthèse
Utilisation des logiciels de gestion
Négociation
Esprit d'initiative
Esprit d'équipe
Management d'équipe
Gestion des priorités
## Company Information
Safran is an international high-technology group, operating in the aviation (propulsion, equipment and interiors), defense and space markets. Its core purpose is to contribute to a safer, more sustainable world, where air transport is more environmentally friendly, comfortable and accessible. Safran has a global presence, with 100,000 employees and sales of 27.3 billion euros in 2024, and holds, alone or in partnership, world or regional leadership positions in its core markets.
Safran is in the 2nd place in the aerospace and defense industry in TIME magazine's "World's best companies 2024" ranking.

Safran Aircraft Engines designs, produces and sells, alone or in partnership, commercial and military aircraft engines offering world-class performance, reliability and environmental compliance. Through CFM International\, Safran Aircraft Engines is the world's leading supplier of engines for single-aisle mainline commercial jets. \* CFM International is a 50/50 joint venture between Safran Aircraft Engines and GE Aerospace

Greet and receive all plant visitors and maintain visitor log; distribute and collect visitor identification badges as needed.
Monitor and catalog company and lease vehicles, mobile phones, etc.
Assist with, as needed, travel arrangements in Morocco, EU, and overseas.  Liaising with people internal to the Company and an external travel supplier to make sure all arrangements are finalized, and any problems resolved.  Order currency if needed.
Organize meetings, conferences, events, conference calls, and video conferences on and off-site, in Morocco, the EU, and overseas. This includes all aspects of meetings from refreshments to reserving meeting rooms. Collate data prior to meetings.
Perform general administrative duties including developing general correspondence, filing, scanning documents, updating spreadsheets, forms, and data bases, and creating presentations, charts, and graphs for Plant Management and other staff, as necessary.
Assist Accounting, Procurement, and HR departments with filing, receiving goods, Accounts Payable, making orders, etc., in addition to archiving and monitoring administrative files
Maintain and monitor IT equipment and keep regular inventory and ordering if additional needs  
Qualifications:

University degree
Experience of at least 5 years in similar position in industrial companies
Excellent written and verbal French & English
Excellent communication skills
Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint…)
High degree of attention to detail
Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and translate documents
Candidates must be eligible to work in the country where the position is based. Hexcel (NYSE: HXL) is a global leader in advanced composites technology, a leading producer of carbon fiber, and the world leader in honeycomb manufacturing for the commercial aerospace industry.

Description de l'entreprise
Accélérez votre carrière au sein d’un groupe d’ingénierie mondial à forte croissance. Chez SEGULA Technologies, vous travaillerez sur des projets passionnants et contribuerez à façonner l’avenir au sein d’une entreprise pour qui l’innovation est indissociable de l’ingénierie.

Intelligence artificielle, nouvelles mobilités, décarbonation, usine du futur… rythment le quotidien de nos 15 000 ingénieux collaborateurs, pourquoi pas le vôtre ?

À côté de chez vous ou à l’autre bout de la planète, vous trouverez chez SEGULA Technologies l’opportunité qui donnera un sens nouveau à votre carrière !

intro:
Company Description
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
description:
Job Description
Purpose 

Supporting the sales team by providing business and technical knowledge of payment acceptance processes and associated products and services for Visa Acceptance Solutions Product Pillars (including Digital Accept, In-person Accept, Payment Processing, Transaction Management & Optimization, Fraud Management, Risk Management and Post Transaction Management).  

The scope of the role pertains to working and servicing the CEMEA region - supporting new and existing install base clients, for a single instance or combination of the Visa Acceptance Solutions core products and services, including, but not limited to: Payment Acceptance, Payment Security, Fraud & Risk Services. 

Principle Responsibilities 

Develop in-depth knowledge of Visa Acceptance Solutions products through research and testing to function as subject matter expert with prospective customers through self-enabled product & services learning, through technical testing & investigative exercises. The broader Value-Added Services team and line manager will support you. 

Maintain accurate, up to date, product and services knowledge through knowledge sharing via global teams and working collaboratively with product teams across Visa Acceptance Solutions through self-enabled product and services learning, through technical testing & investigative exercises. The broader Value-Added Services team & line manager will support you. 

Provide technical pre-sales support by accompanying CEMEA sales team to meetings with large and complex prospects. This would typically involve giving presentations to prospective and existing clients, providing product demonstrations, and using whiteboard sessions, all with a focus on maintaining a sales-oriented approach to solutioning the client’s requirements through discovery phase exercises whilst using product, services and industry knowledge to remain flexible in approach, adapting to challenging, pressured situations to deliver technical excellence. 

Deliver client-focused, technical consultancy engagements to agree solution design and technically validate that the proposed solution can be implemented and will meet the client requirements. 

Support the handover to Implementation Specialists to ensure efficient implementation. 

Engage, support, and collaborate with prospective clients across the following verticals: Retail, Travel, Digital, Financial, Government & Gaming. 

Provide proposal support to the CEMEA sales team, for technical sections of RFI and RFP documents. 

Write & develop small internal computer applications to provide proof-of-concept ideas, to evaluate Visa Acceptance Solutions products, and to troubleshoot client issues by supporting Visa Acceptance Solutions prospects in partnership with the broader Value-Added Services team and line manager and through application of knowledge and experience through self-enablement. 

To troubleshoot client issues by supporting Visa Acceptance Solutions prospects, existing clients, and the CEMEA sales team during presales solutioning in partnership with the broader Value-Added Services team. 

Provide training on Visa Acceptance Solutions products and services to customers either as classroom based or as train the trainer sessions. Produce clear and precise documentation for clients based on business and functional requirements to support successful implementation of the solution. 

Ability to work independently on customer sites with minimal supervision around the CEMEA region. 

This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.


Qualifications
Required Experience

Demonstrable experience (10 years +) of the Payment Acceptance industry with specific emphasis on the product pillars of Digital Accept, In-person Accept, Payment Processing, Transaction Management & Optimization, Fraud Management, Risk Management or Post Transaction Management or a similar technology, service delivery industry.

Demonstrable experience (5 years +) working as a sales engineer in a technical and commercial environment.

Demonstrable experience of providing on-going support to large, complex, Direct and Indirect level clients over prolonged periods of time.

Demonstratable impact of cross functional collaboration between technical, commercial, service delivery, and support teams.

Demonstrate working knowledge of intermediary level of programming & scripting skills (JavaScript, Java, PHP, C++/.NET, HTML etc.) for effective implementation of the Visa Acceptance Solutions products & services.

Demonstrable experience in communicating technical concepts in a clear and articulate fashion to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Strong, evidenced track record in high customer focus and attention to detail.

Excellent communication and negotiation skills.

Fully fluent in mainstream software applications for writing, presentation, data management.

Preferred Experience

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Information Technology, or equivalent.

Demonstrable years of dedicated pre-sales, service delivery or consultancy for multi-national and global engagements.

Experience of technical programming for implementation of web service environment across hosted service platforms

Ability to speak French and Arabic is must.


Additional Information
Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Oser et créer.

intro:
About the job Amazon Brand Manager (PPC focus)
Join our dynamic client, a close-knit team of seven remote professionals spread across the globe, in their search for a top-tier Amazon Brand Manager with strong expertise in PPC. This exciting role involves managing three diverse brands in medical supplies, decorations, and clothing, showcasing your ability to drive profitable growth through PPC strategies. One of these brands is https://voilechic.com/.
With 80% of sales coming from just a handful of products, we need a detail-oriented individual well-versed in Amazon ranking, conversion optimization, PPC campaign management, keyword research, and brand analytics (SQP).
If you're a strategic thinker with hands-on experience in PPC and a drive to deliver exceptional results, we want to connect with you!

Key Responsibilities:

Increase Sales & Profit: Develop and execute strategies aimed at boosting overall revenue and profitability for our account.
Optimize Listings: Write and refine listings, perform keyword research, and employ best practices to enhance visibility, click-through rates, and conversions.
Manage PPC Campaigns: Strategically plan, implement, and optimize PPC campaigns for efficiency and growth, keeping ACoS and TACoS in mind.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Monitor critical metrics (conversion rates, rankings, keyword relevancy, etc.) and leverage insights from Brand Analytics SQP to inform decisions.
Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with our global team via Slack to share updates, solve problems, and drive results.
Requirements:

3+ Years of Amazon Experience: Proven track record of driving significant growth for Amazon businesses.
Strong Analytical Skills: Deep understanding of key metrics (ranking, conversion, PPC, KW relevancy) and how they interrelate.
Remote Work Savvy: Comfortable working independently in a remote environment and maintaining consistent communication with the team.
Schedule Flexibility: Ability to work primarily 9-5 EST while accommodating some flexibility.
What We Offer:

Competitive salary
Performance-based bonuses - tied to achieving sales and profitability targets
Global team - be part of a diverse and collaborative team of professionals working across different time zones
We are ready to onboard the right candidate quickly

### Role Purpose
The General Trade Channel Manager will be responsible for developing and executing strategies to drive sales and growth. This role requires a strategic thinker with excellent communication skills and a proven track record of building and maintaining successful partnerships.
### Additional information
We embrace Diversity and Inclusion and are committed to providing equal opportunities to all of our applicants – regardless of race, gender, age, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation and gender identity, disability, cultural, ethnic or national origins. We would therefore kindly ask you to include only information and data in your documents which are relevant for the assessment of your application (e.g. curriculum vitae, salary expectations, relevant references and certificates) and encourage you to upload your CV without a picture.
Have a look at our benefits:
### About Beiersdorf
At Beiersdorf, we want to help people feel good about their skin – and our commitment goes far beyond caring for skin. For 140 years, we have developed innovative skin and body care products for well-known brands such as NIVEA, Eucerin, La Prairie, Hansaplast, and Labello. We act according to our purpose, WE CARE BEYOND SKIN, and take responsibility for our consumers, our employees, the environment and society.
Behind every brand, every product and every accomplishment are our more than 20,000 employees. It is for them that we live a culture of inclusion, respect and trust that is strongly aligned with our values CARE, COURAGE, SIMPLICITY and TRUST. We embrace diversity by valuing the uniqueness of each individual and being committed to equal opportunities for all.

Help shape the future of mobility.

Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv’s passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Position Summary

Conduct the programming of the electrical control and ensure that the customer's requirements and standards are met to guarantee good quality for all cables.

Your Role

As a ROB & Testing Process Technician, you will be in charge of these various accountabilities:

Realize all the programming of the different electrical control benches within the company.
Detect and solve electrical problems on electrical benches and perform pawn tests.
Communicate to the auditor and foreman the progress of the existing bench at the chain level.
Validate the electrical test bench to ensure the reliability of the results emitted by it.
Record and install the electrical control programs and counters in the respective benches.
Your Background

Bac+2; Specialized Technician in Computer Development
Good level in English is desirable.
Computer skills and problem-solving techniques are required.
Strong analytical and synthesis skills
Availability & Flexibility
Why join us?

You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health.
Your Benefits at Aptiv:

Competitive compensation
Learning, professional growth and development in a world recognized international environment.
Access to internal & external training, coaching & certifications.
Recognition for innovation and excellence.
Opportunities to give back to the community.
Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world
Apply today, and together let’s change tomorrow!

TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS ENGINEER

Responsible for working with sales reps, business partners and end users to create Security Policy based on customer requirements.

intro:
Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv’s passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your Role

As a Material Planner you will be part of a global, diverse and collaborative team and contributing on high sophisticated compute and sensing products driving to a safer, greener and more connected future of mobility.

 In this role you will play a key role in Aptiv, you will ensure the availability of the raw material at the right time while ensuring the required quality as well as these various accountabilities:

Monitor any anomalies from the supplier
Analyze WIP storage (overstock, stock shortage and negative stock) weekly
Detect and track anomalies (cutting, production, engineering) causing stock shortages, and make sure to transfer anomaly cases to Key Users via ID Tool
Clear orders weekly to avoid overstocking
Monitor the transport of goods (Pickup & arrival) and ensure proper flow management via MRP and SAP.
Your Background

Engineering degree or Master degree in Logistics or equivalent.
Advanced English is mandatory
Knowledge of logistics process
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills, problem-solving and analytical skills are required
Advanced computer skills
Why join us?

You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health.
Your Benefits at Aptiv:

Competitive compensation package including; Bonus Potential, Healthcare, Pension schemes. 
Learning, professional growth and development in a world recognized international environment.
 Access to internal & external training, coaching & certifications.   Recognition for innovation and excellence. 
 Opportunities to give back to the community. Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world
Apply today, and together let’s change tomorrow! 

Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

titre: Business Research - Research Team Lead / Junior Manager - Casablanca
intro:
About us

Infomineo is a fast-growing business insights provider, bringing Brainshoring to global clients across a range of services: Business research, Content Services, Graphic Design, and Data Analytics. Our clients include leading Consultancies, Fortune 500 companies, Governments, and NGOs. Infomineo counts 350+ employees spread across 5 offices covering EMEA and the Americas (Casablanca, Cairo, Dubai, Barcelona and Mexico City). 

About this role

Are you intellectually curious? Do you have a knack for solving puzzles? Do you want to make an impact? If yes, this role is right for you. As a Business Research Team Lead at Infomineo, you'll be responsible for performing research, answering clients’ requests and leading a team of analysts in business and investment research needs across different regions and industries.

What you will do

Perform research, answer client requests and autonomously lead a team of analysts and associates in business and investment research
Train, lead and coach a team, clarifying each team member's responsibilities and setting up clear processes
Be the primary contact for our clients, perform QA and set up QA processes for the team ensuring that requests are verified, reliable and up to the very high client standards
Lead and manage different clients, projects and or teams simultaneously, and setting priorities and budget time for each component
Manage a team, clarify objectives, timeline, and responsibilities
Act as professional development coach, by providing coaching, training, constructive feedback, and development career path for the team
Collaborate with the Professional Development team to create and deliver quality training (onboarding and ongoing training)
Ensure a high level of motivation within the team to deliver excellence
Support with the screening selections for the right candidates.
Support to drive different initiatives important to the company
Who you are

Have a master’s degree and a minimum of 4 years of relevant work experience
Have some team management experience
Extensive secondary research experience covering the MENA Region
Able to step back, analyze problems, find solutions, and implement these
Creative and resourceful, with an ability to find information using different tools
Good interpersonal skills and organizational skills, high motivation, an attention to detail, flexibility, and ability to cope under stress, a focus on identifying the solutions to problems
Good management skills with a track record of coordinating workflow and assuring quality for small to medium teams with a strong ability to multitask
Full proficiency in English and French. Any additional language is a real plus
Have expertise with research databases
What we offer

A competitive local salary
Health insurance Benefits
A healthy work-life balance
A steep learning curve with interesting and diverse topics to work on
A great working environment
Don’t hesitate. Apply by clicking on the button. Kindly include a cover letter with your application. We want to learn more about you!

What is it like to work at Infomineo?
If you've spoken with someone who works at Infomineo, you've probably heard that our people are our most valuable asset. Our diversity, both in terms of professional experience and culture, is the company’s greatest strength.

By being a part of Infomineo, you'll have the opportunity to work alongside a friendly, smart, and international team of researchers that value intellectual vitality and creativity. You will learn the best practices, tools to use when conducting primary and secondary research. You will grow your career, expertise across different regions and industries. As a member of the team, you'll be encouraged to contribute by applying your ideas while playing an instrumental role in the company’s development and growth. Within this role, you'll support leading international institutions & companies with the data and information required to fuel key business decisions

Equal opportunity employer

Infomineo is an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any sort of discrimination (based on color, race, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin or any other attributes) in all aspects of employment (recruiting, hiring, wages and salary, promotions, benefits, trainings and job termination).

If you believe you match our requirements and values, we would be happy to hear from you. Visit our website to know more about us, our services and company culture.

At JTI we celebrate differences, and everyone truly belongs. 46,000 people from all over the world are continuously building their unique success story with us. 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI.

To make a difference with us, all you need to do is bring your human best.

What will your story be? Apply now!  

Learn more: jti.com

WAREHOUSE ASSOCIATE 

For the new tobacco factory in TETOUAN, we are looking for aWarehouse Associate to manage inventory, handle materials, and ensure compliance with safety and JTI standards. This is an on-site position.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

You will be fully responsible for Spare parts warehouse & support other WHs-related activities, including inventory management, analysis, and reporting in SAP (Tobacco, Non-tobacco materials, Finished Goods, and Spare Parts) and MOM, ensuring all materials are received, stored, and loaded correctly in the warehouse.
You will analyze inventory levels, monitor stock turnover, and ensure compliance with government requirements and JTI standards, including safety and 5S3R policies for Spare parts WHs & other WHs.
You will track inventory movements (Leaf, NTM, SP, FG), manage waste, and coordinate actions related to write-offs or sales.
You will supervise inventory reconciliation, SAP treatment, and ensure accurate data reporting for inventory management.
You will prepare and deliver reports to relevant parties, including inventory, overtime, and vacation usage reports.
You will support cost center follow-up and assist with variance explanations, as well as prepare ASP templates for the warehouse.
You will ensure adherence to EHS standards and support warehouse compliance with JTI 5S3R standards
You will handle PR/PO cycles for the warehouse, including creating PRs and processing invoices accurately.
You will perform any other tasks assigned by the direct manager and be accountable for special projects as needed.
EDUCATION

University degree in Business Administration or industrial Engineering.

WORK EXPERIENCE

3 years experience , Knowledge of  Supply Chain operations; Involvement & knowledge of  Warehouses operations.
competences:
SKILLS

SAP & Inventory Management – Strong understanding of SAP, MOM, and inventory tracking across various materials (Leaf, NTM, SP, FG).
Warehouse Operations & Compliance – Knowledge of 5S3R, EHS standards, and governmental compliance for warehouse management.
Analytical & Process Optimization Skills – Ability to analyze KPIs, capacity utilization, and workflows to drive continuous improvement.
Organizational & Multitasking Abilities – Strong attention to detail in reporting, effective task prioritization, and meeting deadlines.
Collaboration & Technical Proficiency – Fluent in English, experienced in cross-functional teamwork, with intermediate MS Office skills; SAP knowledge is a plus.
If you feel your skills and experience align with our requirements. We invite you to apply through the link provided.

Are you ready to join us? Build your success story at JTI. Apply now!

Next Steps:

After applying, if selected, please anticipate the following within 1-3 weeks of the job posting closure: Phone screening with Talent Advisor > Assessment tests > Interviews > Offer. Each step is eliminatory and may vary by role type.

At JTI, we strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you need any specific support, alternative formats, or have other access requirements, please let us know.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
About Abbott:

Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

Working at Abbott

At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You will have access to:

·Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.

·A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.

·A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.

About Medical Devices Division

-General Medical Devices:

Our medical devices help more than 10,000 people have healthier hearts, improve quality of life for thousands of people living with chronic pain and movement disorders, and liberate more than 500,000 people with diabetes from routine ﬁngersticks.

-CRM Division

As a global leader in Cardiac Rhythm Technologies, we focus on innovative technologies that can improve the way doctors treat people with heart arrhythmias, or irregular heartbeats.

The Opportunity

Executive Assistant/ Compliance Support-MEA

The Executive Assistant/compliance support MEA provides administrative and project assistance to the General Manager. Other duties and responsibilities include providing administrative support to ensure efficient operation of the office. Supports managers and employees through a variety of tasks related to organization and communication. Responsible for confidential and time sensitive material. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, policies and procedures. Ability to effectively communicate via phone and email ensuring that all Administrative Assistant duties are completed accurately and delivered with high quality and in a timely manner and according to Company Policies. May direct and lead the work of others. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals and a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.

What You’ll Do

·Responsibilities include all administrative functions: Calendar/Outlook management, Organizing meetings/ follow-ups, preparing Minutes of meetings, meeting/event planning, Scheduling travels (hotel booking/ dinners/ transfers etc), managing correspondence and scheduling couriers, processing expense reports, , creating or modifying business documents, preparing presentations from source materials, handling teleconference setups, acting as a liaison for remote access issues.

·Preparing and following up compliance paperwork.

·Preparing and/or editing documents :Tender,contract.

·Follow up on progress of marketing activities.

·Include support for preparing business activities OPEX and obtaining necessary approvals as well as tracking budget expenditures.

·Supports the team to plan, document and conduct business and marketing events according to Compliance policy.

·Processes incoming invoices, file and keep records.

·Coordinates and maintains departmental files, as assigned, in compliance with corporate and government regulations.

·Follows purchasing and requisition procedures, Corporate Security and Privacy Rules, Corporate Branding Guidelines, and Copy Center procedures (if applicable).

·Arranges and prepares necessary documents for office and building access for internal staff and visitors.

·Orders business cards and stationery.

·Uses basic to intermediate software skills to perform work assigned.

·Uses and understands Microsoft Office Suite and other business-specific software, including the Corporate Travel website, and employee performance management systems (as applicable). Coordinates new employee office set-ups and on-boarding.

·May train/coordinate work with other administrative assistants.

Accountability / Scope/Budget:

·Frequently interacts with high-level executives. 

·Basic to intermediate knowledge and understanding of business processes and requirements.  

·Frequently handles confidential or business-sensitive information. Data is typically employee-level or one-dimensional.

·Maintains and manages calendars, including meeting and travel scheduling and domestic and international travel arrangements.

·Proactively identifies and resolves scheduling conflicts.

·May be the primary point of contact for Regional Director’s schedule.

·Participate in multi-divisional project teams (when appropriate to experience and knowledge base, e.g. internet knowledge), with Regional Director, in order to follow-up with team members on action items when required.

Requirements:

·Any Graduate (Office Administration, or related field)

·3-5 years of experience as an Executive Assistant to VP or Director

·Fluent in English, Arabic and French

·Strong computer skills: MS Office, Webex, Teams

·Ability to work under pressure

·Excellent interpersonal skills

·Excellent time management skills, self-discipline and focus

·Excellent accuracy and follow-up skills

·Reliable/Dependable/Punctual

·Ability to handle confidential information

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

# Manufacturing & Proces Development Engineer
At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.
##
Job Overview


TE Connectivity's Manufacturing and Process Development Engineering Teams significantly impact LEANPD driven new product development projects, driving for excellence in existing manufacturing technologies and methods and striving to implement new manufacturing technologies to provide improved process and tolerance control. They act as the binding element between product development and manufacturing engineering, ensuring the effectiveness and efficiency of this critical interface. They support Product Development in the optimization of designs and piece parts for manufacturability by realizing sample tooling/products/prototypes. They also design, develop, and qualify tooling and processes to meet TE quality and production standards, document all processes and tooling in applicable TE systems, support supply chain to verify supplier compliance and capability, initiate and implement programs to continuously improve quality, cost and cycle time and adhere to all appropriate specifications, regulatory requirements and customer requirements.
##
Tasks and Responsibilities


Support Product Engineering to optimize Design for manufacturing (DFM) & Design for Assembly (DFA). Create concept and specification for request of serial assembly (manual, semi-automatic, full-automatic) in cooperation with the responsible team member. Configuration of the best possible equipment / processes to create cost calculation for management presentation/decision RfQ for pilot equipment. Follow up of cost, timing and quality in NPI or strategic projects. Lead the PFMEA fir process under development. Control of progress steps during tool / equipment build phase (global supply base). Provide samples and measurement report to PE for evaluation. Check of tool / equipment for release acc. Specification. Run Acceptance test (at supplier / plant) of the equipment for release acc. Specification (R@R).
##
What your background should look like:


Engineering degree ( Bac+5) with a specialization in Automation, Industrial, or mechanical Engineering. Experience and knowledge in the field of assembly technology (Mechanical Design / Automation / PLC programming / Test programming). Experience and knowledge in the development of customized machines. Knowledge of molding or stamping is a plus. Extensive understanding of LEAN manufacturing processes. Experience in project management. Customer orientation and high level of commitment. Willingness to drive continuous improvements. Ability to work in a matrix environment with a multicultural team. Very good oral and written communication skills in English. Strategic thinking. Presentation skills.
##
Competencies

Filiale du Groupe Société Générale, Société Générale Africa Technologies and Services (SG ATS) a été créée en 2014 dans le but de fournir des solutions agiles et efficaces aux salles des marchés de la banque en Europe (principalement à Paris et Londres) afin de les aider à se développer et à répondre aux exigences de plus en plus fortes imposées par les différentes législations bancaires internationales. 
Forte de son succès, SG ATS ambitionne de devenir un centre multi-services, toujours en fournissant des prestations à forte valeur ajoutée à différentes lignes de métiers du Groupe (en Europe principalement mais également aux Etats-Unis et en Asie) sur des activités de marchés, mais également à la direction des risques, la direction financière, la direction de la conformité et à d’autres directions centrales. 
Sacrée « Meilleur Employeur 2023 – Maroc », SG ATS est une structure jeune, dynamique qui positionne le capital humain au centre de son développement et s’entoure de talents qui participeront activement à la réussite de l’entreprise tout en évoluant dans un environnement international propice au développement de compétences différenciantes.

• Création de « tableaux de marges » EXCEL (Prix public / Prix de vente/ Prix d’achat / marge / remises à appliquer etc.) et renseignement administratif du dossier (Contact client, dates du projet, CDP, fournisseur, compte client etc.)
• Rédiger des comptes-rendus
• Gérer la base de données clients (CRM) Créer, ouvrir les comptes des nouveaux clients
• Faire l'interface avec les équipes ADV, logistique et production
Le tout, dans le respect des règles administratives, juridiques, financières, éthiques et commerciales fixées par Orange Business.

Au moins 5 ans dans une position similaire, vous maîtrisez les outils bureautiques classiques (Excel, Word, …)
Dynamique, doté(e) d'un excellent relationnel, vous êtes passionné(e) par votre métier et avez le goût du service.
Nous avons donc besoin de quelqu’un de polyvalent et de proactif.

Orange Business dispose de compétences pointues et reconnues dans l'intégration de solutions globales en Réseaux (LAN/WAN/WIFI/Data Center), Communications Unifiées (Microsoft, Polycom) et Mobilité auprès de clients grands comptes. titre: Director – Product Management, Cross Border Payments
intro:
Our Purpose

Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.

Title and Summary

Director – Product Management, Cross Border PaymentsWho is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.
Overview
Mastercard’s Transfer Solutions team in EEMEA is driving at scale innovation and growth to meet today’s demands for simple, certain, and secure international and domestic payments by individual and businesses of all sizes. Transfer Solutions is a portfolio of integrated assets and capabilities designed to service key verticals, customer segments and multiple payment flows. Through simple connectivity means, we enable partners the ability to reach a variety of endpoints—account, card, mobile wallet, or cash payout—nearly anywhere in the world.

The organization is looking for a Director, Product Management, Cross Border Payments as part of the EEMEA Business Development Team, to work with customers, who are primarily large pan-African Group Banks to further the strategic and commercial agenda of Mastercard in the region, especially around Cross Border Payments, which includes Low Value B2B / Commercial Payments, P2P Remittances and Purpose-based payments like Bill Payments, Tuition Payments, Utility, Social Security etc.

The ideal candidate is aware of the African Payments landscape and is a known name within the circles of Financial Institutions in Africa. He / She must be aware of the intricate dynamics of how money moves across Banks and Borders, especially relating to Correspondent Banking, evolving nature of SWIFT and ISO messaging standards, existing Settlement & Funding Structures, thereby able to identify the existing gaps, and solutionize placing Mastercard assets in the mix with customers. The person must hold adequate subject-matter expertise to hold conversation with banking leaders ranging from Transaction Banking, Treasury, Retail or Payment System Design and drive home desired commercial outcomes for the company.
Role

• This is a PreSales Solutioning roles at its heart where you will work with new prospects and existing clients in providing the commercial and technical solution, to drive sale and launch of Mastercard’s Cross Border Payments asset to the large pan African Banks.
• Own the Sales Solutioning cycle, end-to-end, when working with large / multi-market prospects, positioning Mastercard’s Cross-Border Payments assets, either as a standalone deal or as part of a clubbed multi-product engagement.
• Partner with MA Account Management, and in-country Cross-Border Sales teams during the Sales and / or Implementation Cycle with a Customer and provide deep subject matter expertise required for the opportunity conversion.
• You can either choose to be - Accountable for successful conversion of the opportunity cycle. In short, while you own the Commercial and Techno-Functional Solution, your counterpart teams in MA owns the Relationship and Revenue Realization cycle. OR,
• Alternatively – be accountable to lead, with minimal supervision, the complete Sales and GTM efforts within assigned territories and Accounts, including relationship and full scale PnL responsibilities.
• Internal concept selling within the company, at an Account / Country level, for appropriate customer engagement required to drive conversion. Responsible for driving market adoption of Mastercard’s cross-border solutions, in partnership with the Cluster teams.
• Be able to independently and in teams communicate the needed product capabilities for the markets and clients, and work with various teams within the organization to get them to life.
• Develops and maintains strong working relationships, working closely with cross-functional teams across the organization, to drive the Transfer Solutions agenda.
All About You

The ideal candidate for this position should:
• Have worked in Product Management roles in Cross Border Payments processing teams of large Transaction Banks working in / focused on Africa.
• Alternate, have worked in Sales Solutioning role within Cross Border Payments industry OR Market Infrastructure providers, preferably in Africa.
• Understand and know how NOSTRO pricing works, along with Africa specific challenges of Currency Control, Correspondent De-Risking etc.
• Understand SWIFT, RTGS, ACH, and emerging Multi-lateral payment schemes and the constructs that exists in Africa. Knowledge of alternate technical architecture is a big plus.
• Have firsthand experienced business and sales lifecycle of products and offerings along with prospecting, conversion funnel, launch, and PnL responsibilities.
• Known face in the markets, with existing relationship and credibility to hold deep subject-matter conversations on the topics.
• You enjoy learning new things and can pick up concepts quickly and connect the dots independently without the need of formal & extensive training.
• Demonstrated success working with stakeholders across other business units, functions, and markets in support of cross-functional projects / programs.
Must have strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Arabic and French
Corporate Security Responsibility


All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;

Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;

Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and

Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

intro:
SUMMARY OF THE ROLE

Provide professional technical advice to our customers, by on-site support on paint application and inspections to ensure that the coating specification is met, and the job is completed according to the contract and the customer’s satisfaction.
Responsibilities: 

Give clear instructions to clients and relevant Jotun staff on paint application by working on site with relevant client representatives to ensure the coating specification is met and in accordance with customer expectations.

Carry out inspections of a specific project assigned to you by your direct manager by working independently, following the ITP and working procedures in order to ensure that the product is applied in accordance with the specification.

Write relevant reports by compiling data from inspections in order to document that the specification inspection criteria have been met.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR AND WHAT WE OFFER

What we are looking for:

Technical diploma with minimum 2 years of experiecne in related field.

French, Arabic & English languages are required.

What we offer:

Competitive compensation and benefits

Continuous learning opportunities and training activities through on-the-job training and our in-house learning Jotun Academy

Career development opportunities across multiple disciplines and geographies

Leaders who focus on engaging and enabling their team, proven by consistently high employee feedback scores

A supportive and inclusive company culture where you can be your authentic self

A focus on having fun together through team building and social activities

Company:

Jotun Maroc Sarl D Associe Unique

Contract Type:

Regular
Time Type:

Full time
CLOSING DATE (dd.mm.yyyy):

30.05.2025
WHO WE ARE

Jotun’s story in the MEIA region (Middle East, India and Africa) began in 1962, and has grown to include 18 legal entities committed to achieving success and growth of the Jotun Group. Throughout our history, we have focused on providing our employees with meaningful and challenging work, rewarding them through continued learning and development, underpinned by our values of Loyalty, Care, Respect and Boldness.Jotun Maroc, established in 2009, is one of the key markets within the MEIA region. With a sales office and a rapidly growing team, we aim to further strengthen Jotun’s position in Morocco through ambitious market growth plans that focus on innovation, efficiency and profitability.
Visit our Career Page to know more about life at Jotun.

Jotun’s company culture welcomes and values differences in people. Our more than 10,200 employees on all continents represent 90 nationalities, four generations and diversity of professions, gender, abilities, ethnicities, beliefs, cultures etc. We are committed to represent the societies we operate in, promoting equality, equity and zero-tolerance for discrimination.

Quel profil nous recherchons?

Responsible for monitoring programs, large projects. Their main responsibilities are to streamline and standardize processes when managing projects; assist in prioritizing projects within the organization, manage resources (not people) associated with projects, financial management of programs, etc.

Nos avantages…

Développement de nouvelles fonctionnalités ;

Amélioration/Optimisation du code existant ;

Mise en œuvre des bonnes pratiques techniques ;

Résolution de bugs ;

Le travail demandé sera principalement sur un seul site web

Aimes-tu le défi? prêt pour faire partie de l’équipe? N’hésitez pas de partager votre candidature! 

Chez Babel, nous favorisons un environnement de travail basé sur le respect de nos professionnels, le développement professionnel et la promotion de l'égalité des chances sans aucune discrimination.

Conformément à la législation en vigueur en matière de protection des données, nous vous informons que le GRUPO BABEL est responsable de vos données personnelles (voir les entreprises dans la politique de confidentialité), et qu'il les utilisera pour gérer vos processus de sélection, actuels et futurs, ainsi que pour les autres finalités décrites sur le site web. Ce traitement est basé sur le consentement du candidat. Les données personnelles collectées ne seront en aucun cas transférées à des tiers, sauf en cas d'obligations légales expresses. Vous pouvez exercer vos droits en matière de protection des données à l'adresse suivante : data.protection@babelgroup.com. Toutes les informations sur la politique de confidentialité sont disponibles sur notre site web.
# Title:  SALES & RTM INTERN
description:
Description: 
 
As a Top Employer JTI is also an investor in people. We are happy to welcome young talents helping you to kick start your career within JTI or outside JTI.
Currently, we are looking for a Sales & RTM Intern to join our team and support the company’s sales strategies and RTM practices.
If you have an analytical mindset, you will be a great addition to our team for this 6 months paid internship.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING


Generate dashboards and reports for sales pilot programs and initiatives in Morocco and Western Africa. Enhance dashboard reporting for merchandising activities with Merch Time, Motion, and Merch Visit Execution Reports for Morocco and Tunisia, and Libya. Develop internal expertise on routing processes and standardize methodologies at the cluster level. Document best practices for Route-to-Market strategies. Assist in financial model assessment for different selling models.
EDUCATION


University degree in Sales, Business Administration, Economics, or Engineering.
WORK EXPERIENCE


We are open for the Graduates with minimal experience.
competences:
SKILLS


Fluency in English, French and Arabic. Good hand with numbers and systems. Some knowledge of sales and RTM practices. Some knowledge of Power BI, SQL, and Python Negotiation skills. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
